text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने द्युभिस्त्वमाशुशुक्षणिस्त्वमद्भ्यस्त्वमश्मनस्परि ।त्वं वनेभ्यस्त्वमोषधीभ्यस्त्वं नृणां नृपते जायसे शुचिः ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  dyu-bhiḥ  tvam  āśuśukṣaṇiḥ  tvam  at-bhyaḥ  tvam  aśmanaḥ  pari tvam  vanebhyaḥ  tvam  oṣadhībhyaḥ  tvam  nṛṇām  nṛ-pate  jāyase  śuciḥ ||

translations.text: Sovereign of men,Agni, you are born for the days (of sacrifice), pure and all-irradiating, from the waters, from the stones, from trees, and from plural nts.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रमृत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं त्वमग्निदृतायतः ।तव प्रशास्त्रं त्वमध्वरीयसि ब्रह्मा चासि गृहपतिश्च नो दमे ॥
text.iast: tava  agne  hotram  tava  potram  ṛtvíyam  tava  neṣṭram  tvam  agnít  ṛta-yataḥ tava  pra-śāstram  tvam  adhvari-yasi  brahmā  ca  asi  gṛha-patiḥ  ca  naḥ  dame ||

translations.text: YoursAgni, is the office of theHotā, of thePotā, of theṚtvij, of theNeṣṭā; you are theAgnīdhraof the devout; yours is the functionof the Praśāstā; you are theAdhvaryu(adhvaryu radhvarayur adhvaram kāmayata iti vā (Nirukta1.8) and theBrahmā; and the householder in our dwelling.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्न इंद्रो वृषभः सतामसि त्वं विष्णुरुरुगायो नमस्यः ।त्वं ब्रह्मा रयिविद्ब्रह्मणस्पते त्वं विधर्तः सचसे पुरंध्या ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  índraḥ  vṛṣabhaḥ  satām  asi  tvam  víṣṇuḥ  uru-gāyaḥ  namasyaḥ tvam  brahmā  rayi-vít  brahmaṇaḥ  pate  tvam  vidhartaríti vi-dhartaḥ  sacase  puram-dhyā ||

translations.text: You,Agni, areIndra, the showerer (of bounties) on the good; you are adorableViṣṇu, the hymned of many; youBrahmaṇaspati, areBrahmā, the possessor of riches; you, the author of various (conditions) are associated with wisdom.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने राजा वरुणो धृतव्रतस्त्वं मित्रो भवसि दस्म ईड्यः ।त्वमर्यमा सत्पतिर्यस्य संभुजं त्वमंशो विदथे देव भाजयुः ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  rājā  varuṇaḥ  dhṛta-vrataḥ  tvam  mitraḥ  bhavasi  dasmaḥ  īḍyaḥ tvam  aryamā  sat-patiḥ  yasya  sam-bhujam  tvam  aṃśaḥ  vidathe  deva  bhājayuḥ ||

translations.text: You,Agni, are the royalVaruṇa, observant of holy vows; you are the adorableMitra, the destroyer (of foes); you areAryaman, the protector of the virtuous, whose (liberality) is enjoyed by all; you are a portion (of the sun); be the distributor (of good things), divine (Agni), at our sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने त्वष्टा विधते सुवीर्यं तव ग्नावो मित्रमहः सजात्यं ।त्वमाशुहेमा ररिषे स्वश्व्यं त्वं नरां शर्धो असि पुरूवसुः ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  tvaṣṭā  vidhate  su-vīryam  tava  gnāvaḥ  mitra-mahaḥ  sa-jātyam tvam  āśu-hemā  rariṣe  su-aśvyam  tvam  narām  śardhaḥ  asi  puru-vasuḥ ||

translations.text: You,Agni, areTvaṣṭā, (the giver) of great wealth to (your) worshipper; these praises are yours; do you, of benevolent power, (admit) our affinity; you, who are prompt to encourage (us), give us good (store of) horses; you, who abound with opulence, are the strength of men.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने रुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पृक्ष ईशिषे ।त्वं वातैररुणैर्यासि शंगयस्त्वं पूषा विधतः पासि नु त्मना ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  rudraḥ  asuraḥ  mahaḥ  divaḥ  tvam  śardhaḥ  mārutam  pṛkṣaḥ  īśiṣe tvam  vātaiḥ  aruṇaiḥ  yāsi  śam-gayaḥ  tvam  pūṣā  vidhataḥ  pāsi  nu  tmanā ||

translations.text: You,Agni, areRudra, the expeller (of foes) from the expanse of heaven; you are the strength of theMaruts; you are supreme over (sacrificial) food; you, who are plural asantly domiciled (in the hall of sacrifice), go with ruddy horses, (fleet as) the wind; asPūṣan, you cherish, of yours own will, those who offer worship.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने द्रविणोदा अरंकृते त्वं देवः सविता रत्नधा असि ।त्वं भगो नृपते वस्व ईशिषे त्वं पायुर्दमे यस्तेऽविधत् ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  draviṇaḥ-dāḥ  aram-kṛte  tvam  devaḥ  savitā  ratna-dhāḥ  asi tvam  bhagaḥ  nṛ-pate  vasvaḥ  īśiṣe  tvam  pāyuḥ  dame  yaḥ  te  avidhat ||

translations.text: You,Agni, are Draviṇodās, to him who honours you; you are the divineSavitā, the possessor of precious things; protector of men, you areBhaga, and rule over wealth; you are the cherisher of him who worships you in his dwelling.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्ने दम आ विश्पतिं विशस्त्वां राजानं सुविदत्रमृंजते ।त्वं विश्वानि स्वनीक पत्यसे त्वं सहस्राणि शता दश प्रति ॥
text.iast: tvām  agne  dame  ā  viśpatim  víśaḥ  tvām  rājānam  su-vidatram  ṛñjate tvam  víśvāni  su-anīka  patyase  tvam  sahasrāṇi  śatā  daśa  prati ||

translations.text: The people adore you,Agni, the protector of the people in their dwellings; they propitiate you as a benevolent sovereign; leader of a radiant host, you are lord over all offerings; you are the distributor of tens, and hundreds, and thousands (of good things).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्ने पितरमिष्टिभिर्नरस्त्वां भ्रात्राय शम्या तनूरुचं ।त्वं पुत्रो भवसि यस्तेऽविधत्त्वं सखा सुशेवः पास्याधृषः ॥
text.iast: tvām  agne  pitaram  iṣṭí-bhiḥ  naraḥ  tvām  bhrātrāya  śamyā  tanū-rucam tvam  putraḥ  bhavasi  yaḥ  te  avidhat  tvam  sakhā  su-śevaḥ  pāsi  ā-dhṛṣaḥ ||

translations.text: (Devout) men (worship) you,Agni, as a father, with sacred rites; they (cherish) you, who are the illumination of the body, with acts (of kindness), as a brother; you are as a son to him who propitiates you; and you protect us, a faithful and firm friend.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्न ऋभुराके नमस्यस्त्वं वाजस्य क्षुमतो राय ईशिषे ।त्वं वि भास्यनु दक्षि दावने त्वं विशिक्षुरसि यज्ञमातनिः ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  ṛbhuḥ  āke  namasyaḥ  tvam  vājasya  kṣu-mataḥ  rāyaḥ  īśiṣe tvam  ví  bhāsi  anu  dhakṣi  dāvane  tvam  vi-śíkṣuḥ  asi  yajñam  ā-taniḥ ||

translations.text: You,Agni, are (ever) resplendent, and are to be glorified when present; you are lord over all renowned food and riches; you shine brightly, and you consume (the oblation) for him who offers it; you are the especial accomplisher of the sacrifice, and bestower (of its rewards).

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने अदितिर्देव दाशुषे त्वं होत्रा भारती वर्धसे गिरा ।त्वमिळा शतहिमासि दक्षसे त्वं वृत्रहा वसुपते सरस्वती ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  aditiḥ  deva  dāśuṣe  tvam  hotrā  bhāratī  vardhase  girā tvam  íḷā  śata-himā  asi  dakṣase  tvam  vṛtra-hā  vasu-pate  sarasvatī ||

translations.text: You, divineAgni, areAditito the donor of the oblation; you areHotāandBhāratī, and thive by praise; you are Iḷā of a hundred winters to him who makes you gifts; you, lord of wealth, are the destroyer ofVṛtra,Sarasvatī.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने सुभृत उत्तमं वयस्तव स्पार्हे वर्ण आ संदृशि श्रियः ।त्वं वाजः प्रतरणो बृहन्नसि त्वं रयिर्बहुलो विश्वतस्पृथुः ॥
text.iast: tvam  agne  su-bhṛtaḥ  ut-tamam  vayaḥ  tava  spārhe  varṇe  ā  sam-dṛśi  śríyaḥ tvam  vājaḥ  pra-taraṇaḥ  bṛhan  asi  tvam  rayíḥ  bahulaḥ  viśvataḥ  pṛthuḥ ||

translations.text: When, well-cherishedAgni, you are (the giver of) excellent food; in your desirable and delightful hues, beauties (abound) you (are) food; (you are) the transporter (beyond sin); you are mighty; you are wealth; you are manifold, and everhwhere diffused.

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्न आदित्यास आस्यं त्वां जिह्वां शुचयश्चक्रिरे कवे ।त्वां रातिषाचो अध्वरेषु सश्चिरे त्वे देवा हविरदंत्याहुतं ॥
text.iast: tvām  agne  ādityāsaḥ  āsyam  tvām  jihvām  śucayaḥ  cakrire  kave tvām  rāti-sācaḥ  adhvareṣu  saścire  tve íti  devāḥ  havíḥ  adanti  ā-hutam ||

translations.text: TheĀdityashave made you,Agni, their mouth; the pure (deities) have made you,Kavi, their tongue; the (gods), the givers of wealth, depdn upon you at sacrifices; they eat the offered oblation through you.

text.sanskrit: त्वे अग्ने विश्वे अमृतासो अद्रुह आसा देवा हविरदंत्याहुतं ।त्वया मर्तासः स्वदंत आसुतिं त्वं गर्भो वीरुधां जज्ञिषे शुचिः ॥
text.iast: tve íti  agne  víśve  amṛtāsaḥ  adruhaḥ  āsā  devāḥ  havíḥ  adanti  ā-hutam tvayā  martāsaḥ  svadante  ā-sutím  tvam  garbhaḥ  vīrudhām  jajñiṣe  śuciḥ ||

translations.text: All the benignant immortal gods eat the offered oblation through you, as their mouth; mortals taste the flavour (of all viands) through you; you are born pure the embryo of plural nts.

text.sanskrit: त्वं तान्सं च प्रति चासि मज्मनाग्ने सुजात प्र च देव रिच्यसे ।पृक्षो यदत्र महिना वि ते भुवदनु द्यावापृथिवी रोदसी उभे ॥
text.iast: tvam  tān  sam  ca  prati  ca  asi  majmanā  agne  su-jāta  pra  ca  deva  ricyase pṛkṣaḥ  yat  atra  mahinā  ví  te  bhuvat  anu  dyāvāpṛthivī íti  rodasī íti  ubhe íti ||

translations.text: You are associated,Agni, by your vigour, with those (gods); divine, well-born Agni, you exceed (them in strength); for the (sacrificial) food that is here prepared is, by your power, subsequently diffused through both regions, heaven and earth.

text.sanskrit: ये स्तोतृभ्यो गोअग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपसृजंति सूरयः ।अस्मांच तांश्च प्र हि नेषि वस्य आ बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: ye  stotṛ-bhyaḥ  go-agrām  aśva-peśasam  agne  rātím  upa-sṛjanti  sūrayaḥ asmān  ca  tān  ca  pra  hí  neṣi  vasyaḥ  ā  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: The pious are they who present, as a gift, to the reciters of your praises, an excellent cow and an excellent horse; do you,Agni, lead both us and them to the best of abodes, (or heaven), that we and our worthy descendants may repeat the solemn prayer to you at the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: यज्ञेन वर्धत जातवेदसमग्निं यजध्वं हविषा तना गिरा ।समिधानं सुप्रयसं स्वर्णरं द्युक्षं होतारं वृजनेषु धूर्षदं ॥
text.iast: yajñena  vardhata  jāta-vedasam  agnim  yajadhvam  havíṣā  tanā  girā sam-idhānam  su-prayasam  svaḥ-naram  dyukṣam  hotāram  vṛjaneṣu  dhūḥ-sadam ||

translations.text: Exalt with sacrifice,Agni, who knows all that has been born; worship him with oblations, and with ample praise; him who is well kindled, well fed, much lauded, resplendent, the conveyer of oblations, the giver of strength (to the body).

text.sanskrit: अभि त्वा नक्तीरुषसो ववाशिरेऽग्ने वत्सं न स्वसरेषु धेनवः ।दिव इवेदरतिर्मानुषा युगा क्षपो भासि पुरुवार संयतः ॥
text.iast: abhí  tvā  naktīḥ  uṣasaḥ  vavāśire  agne  vatsam  na  svasareṣu  dhenavaḥ divaḥ-iva  ít  aratíḥ  mānuṣā  yugā  ā  kṣapaḥ  bhāsi  puru-vāra  sam-yataḥ ||

translations.text: The mornings and evenings,Agni, are desirous (of worshipping) you, as cows in their stalls long for their calves; adored of many, you, self-controlled, are verily spread through the sky; you (are present at all) the sacred rites of men, and shine brightly by night.

text.sanskrit: तं देवा बुध्ने रजसः सुदंससं दिवस्पृथिव्योररतिं न्येरिरे ।रथमिव वेद्यं शुक्रशोचिषमग्निं मित्रं न क्षितिषु प्रशंस्यं ॥
text.iast: tam  devāḥ  budhne  rajasaḥ  su-daṃsasam  divaḥpṛthivyoḥ  aratím  ní  erire ratham-iva  vedyam  śukra-śociṣam  agnim  mitram  na  kṣitíṣu  pra-śaṃsyam ||

translations.text: The gods have stationed at the root of the world, thatAgniwho is of goodly appearance; the pervader of heaven and earth; who is to be known as a car (to convey men to their wishes); who shines with pure radiance, and who is to be honoured as a friend among mankind.

text.sanskrit: तमुक्षमाणं रजसि स्व आ दमे चंद्रमिव सुरुचं ह्वार आ दधुः ।पृश्न्याः पतरं चितयंतमक्षभिः पाथो न पायुं जनसी उभे अनु ॥
text.iast: tam  ukṣamāṇam  rajasi  sve  ā  dame  candram-iva  su-rucam  hvāre  ā  dadhuḥ pṛśnyāḥ  pataram  citayantam  akṣa-bhiḥ  pāthaḥ  na  pāyum  janasī íti  ubhe íti  anu ||

translations.text: They have plural ced him in his solitary dwelling, who is shedding moisture upon the earth; resplendent as gold, traversing the firmament, animate with flames; and pervading the two parents (of all things, heaven and earth), like refreshing water.

text.sanskrit: स होता विश्वं परि भूत्वध्वरं तमु हव्यैर्मनुष ऋंजते गिरा ।हिरिशिप्रो वृधसानासु जर्भुरद्द्यौर्न स्तृभिश्चितयद्रोदसी अनु ॥
text.iast: saḥ  hotā  víśvam  pari  bhūtu  adhvaram  tam  ūṃ íti  havyaiḥ  manuṣaḥ  ṛñjate  girā hiri-śipraḥ  vṛdhasānāsu  jarbhurat  dyauḥ  na  stṛ-bhiḥ  citayat  rodasī íti  anu ||

translations.text: May he, the presenter of oblations (to the gods), be around all sacrifices; men propitiate him with oblations and with praises, when blazing with radiant tresses among the growing plural nts, and enlivening heaven and earth (with his sparks), like the sky with stars.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स नो रेवत्समिधानः स्वस्तये संददस्वान्रयिमस्मासु दीदिहि ।आ नः कृणुष्व सुविताय रोदसी अग्ने हव्या मनुषो देव वीतये ॥
text.iast: saḥ  naḥ  revat  sam-idhānaḥ  svastaye  sam-dadasvān  rayím  asmāsu  dīdihi ā  naḥ  kṛṇuṣva  suvitāya  rodasī íti  agne  havyā  manuṣaḥ  deva  vītaye ||

translations.text: You,Agni, are he who, for our good, are possessed of riches; kindled by us, blaze as the liberal donor of wealth to us; render heaven and earth propitious to us so that, divine Agni, (the gods) may partake of the oblations of the instrumental tutor of the rite.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: दा नो अग्ने बृहतो दाः सहस्रिणो दुरो न वाजं श्रुत्या अपा वृधि ।प्राची द्यावापृथिवी ब्रह्मणा कृधि स्वर्ण शुक्रमुषसो वि दिद्युतः ॥
text.iast: dāḥ  naḥ  agne  bṛhataḥ  dāḥ  sahasríṇaḥ  duraḥ  na  vājam  śrutyai  apa  vṛdhi prācī íti  dyāvāpṛthivī íti  brahmaṇā  kṛdhi  svaḥ  na  śukram  uṣasaḥ  ví  didyutaḥ ||

translations.text: Bestow upon us,Agni, infinite possessions; grant us thousands (of cattle and dependents); open to us, for your reputation, the doors of abudance; make heaven and earth, propitiated by sacred prayer, favourable to us, and may the mornings light you up like the sun.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स इधान उषसो राम्या अनु स्वर्ण दीदेदरुषेण भानुना ।होत्राभिरग्निर्मनुषः स्वध्वरो राजा विशामतिथिश्चारुरायवे ॥
text.iast: saḥ  idhānaḥ  uṣasaḥ  rāmyāḥ  anu  svaḥ  na  dīdet  aruṣeṇa  bhānunā hotrābhiḥ  agníḥ  manuṣaḥ  su-adhvaraḥ  rājā  viśām  atithiḥ  cāruḥ  āyave ||

translations.text: Kindled at the beautiful dawn, (Agni) shines with brilliant lustre, like the sun; adored by the hymns of the worshipper, Agni, the king of men, (comes as) an agreeable guest to the instrumental tutor of the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: एवा नो अग्ने अमृतेषु पूर्व्य धीष्पीपाय बृहद्दिवेषु मानुषा ।दुहाना धेनुर्वृजनेषु कारवे त्मना शतिनं पुरुरूपमिषणि ॥
text.iast: eva  naḥ  agne  amṛteṣu  pūrvya  dhīḥ  pīpāya  bṛhat-diveṣu  mānuṣā duhānā  dhenuḥ  vṛjaneṣu  kārave  tmanā  śatínam  puru-rūpam  iṣaṇi ||

translations.text: Among men our praise,Agni, celebrate syou, who are first among the greatly-splendid immortals; (may it be to us) as a cow spontaneously yielding at sacrifices to the worshipper, infinite and multiform (blessings according to his) desire.

text.sanskrit: वयमग्ने अर्वता वा सुवीर्यं ब्रह्मणा वा चितयेमा जनाँ अति ।अस्माकं द्युम्नमधि पंच कृष्टिषूच्चा स्वर्ण शुशुचीत दुष्टरं ॥
text.iast: vayam  agne  arvatā  vā  su-vīryam  brahmaṇā  vā  citayema  janān  ati asmākam  dyumnam  adhi  pañca  kṛṣṭíṣu  uccā  svaḥ  na  śuśucīta  dustaram ||

translations.text: May we manifest vigour among other men,Agni, through the steed and the food (which you have given); and may our unsurpassed wealth shine like the sun over (that of) the five classes of beings.

text.sanskrit: स नो बोधि सहस्य प्रशंस्यो यस्मिन्त्सुजाता इषयंत सूरयः ।यमग्ने यज्ञमुपयंति वाजिनो नित्ये तोके दीदिवांसं स्वे दमे ॥
text.iast: saḥ  naḥ  bodhi  sahasya  pra-śaṃsyaḥ  yasmin  su-jātāḥ  iṣayanta  sūrayaḥ yam  agne  yajñam  upa-yanti  vājínaḥ  nítye  toke  dīdi-vāṃsam  sve  dame ||

translations.text: VigorousAgni, hear (our prayers); for you are he who is to be lauded; to whom the well-born priests address (their hymns); and whom, entitled to worship, and radiant in thine own abode, the offerers of the oblation approach, for the sake of never-failing posterity.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: उभयासो जातवेदः स्याम ते स्तोतारो अग्ने सूरयश्च शर्मणि ।वस्वो रायः पुरुश्चंद्रस्य भूयसः प्रजावतः स्वपत्यस्य शग्धि नः ॥
text.iast: ubhayāsaḥ  jāta-vedaḥ  syāma  te  stotāraḥ  agne  sūrayaḥ  ca  śarmaṇi vasvaḥ  rāyaḥ  puru-candrasya  bhūyasaḥ  prajā-vataḥ  su-apatyasya  śagdhi  naḥ ||

translations.text: Agni, knowing all that is born, may we, both adorers and priests, be thine for the sake of felicity; and do you bestow upon us wealth of dwellings, of cattle, of much gold, of many dependents and virtuous offspring.

text.sanskrit: ये स्तोतृभ्यो गोअग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपसृजंति सूरयः ।अस्मांच तांश्च प्र हि नेषि वस्य आ बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: ye  stotṛ-bhyaḥ  go-agrām  aśva-peśasam  agne  rātím  upa-sṛjanti  sūrayaḥ asmān  ca  tān  ca  pra  hí  neṣi  vasyaḥ  ā  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: The pious are they who present, as a gift, to the reciters of your praises, an excellent cow and an elegant horse; do you,Agni, lead us and them to the best of abodes, (or heaven), that we and our worthy descendants may repeat the solemn prayer to you at the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्निर्निहितः पृथिव्यां प्रत्यङ् विश्वानि भुवनान्यस्थात् ।होता पावकः प्रदिवः सुमेधा देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन् ॥
text.iast: sam-iddhaḥ  agníḥ  ní-hitaḥ  pṛthivyām  pratyaṅ  víśvāni  bhuvanāni  asthāt hotā  pāvakaḥ  pra-dívaḥ  su-medhāḥ  devaḥ  devān  yajatu  agníḥ  arhan ||

translations.text: Agni, the well-kindled, plural ced upon (the altar of) the earth, stands in the presence of all beings; the invoker (of the gods), the purifier, the ancient, the intelligent, the divine; let the venerable Agni minister to the gods.

text.sanskrit: नराशंसः प्रति धामान्यंजन् तिस्रो दिवः प्रति मह्ना स्वर्चिः ।घृतप्रुषा मनसा हव्यमुंदन्मूर्धन्यज्ञस्य समनक्तु देवान् ॥

translations.text: May the bright Narāśaṃsa, illuminating the receptacles (of the offering) making manifest by his greatness the three radiant (regions) and diffusing the oblation at the season of sacrifice with butter-dispensing purpose, satisfy the gods.

text.sanskrit: ईळितो अग्ने मनसा नो अर्हंदेवान्यक्षि मानुषात्पूर्वो अद्य ।स आ वह मरुतां शर्धो अच्युतमिंद्रं नरो बर्हिषदं यजध्वं ॥
text.iast: īḷitaḥ  agne  manasā  naḥ  arhan  devān  yakṣi  mānuṣāt  pūrvaḥ  adya saḥ  ā  vaha  marutām  śardhaḥ  acyutam  índram  naraḥ  barhi-sadam  yajadhvam ||

translations.text: Agni, who are the venerable īḷita, do you, with mind favourably disposed towards us, offer today sacrifice to the gods, before the human (ministrant priest) as such, bring hither the company of theMaruts, the undecayingIndra, to whom, seated on the sacred grass, do you priests offer worship.

text.sanskrit: हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुवृक्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसं ।मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद्देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः ॥

translations.text: I invoke, on your behalf, the resplendent, the sinlessAgni, the guest of mortals, the accepter of (sacrificial) food, who, knowing all that has been born, is like a friend, the supporter (of all beings) from men to gods.

text.sanskrit: इमं विधंतो अपां सधस्थे द्वितादधुर्भृगवो विक्ष्वायोः ।एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः ॥

translations.text: TheBhṛgus, worshippingAgni, have twice made him manifest; (once) in the abode of the waters, and (once) among the sons of men; may that Agni, the sovereign of the gods, mounted on a rapid courser, ever overcome all (our foes).

translations.text: The gods, intending to dwell (in heaven), left, as a dear friend among the human races, thatAgni, who, present in the chamber of sacrifice, is bounteous to the donor of offerings, and shines on the nights when he is wished for.

translations.text: The cherishing ofAgniis as agreeable as (the cherishing) of one's self; (plural asant) is his appearance, when spreading abroad, and consuming (the fuel); he brandishes his flame among the bushes, as a chariot-horse lashes with his tail.

translations.text: Whose greatness my colleagues loudly extol; who has manifested his real form to the priests; who is recognized at oblations by his variegated radiance, and who, though frequently growing old, again and again becomes young.

translations.text: Verily, your praise has been recited (by us) at the third (daily) sacrifice, as it was in the repetition on your first propitiation; give us,Agni, ample and notorious food, posterity, riches, such as may be the support of numerous dependents.

text.sanskrit: सृजो महीरिंद्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः ।अमर्त्यं चिद्दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वावृधानः ॥

translations.text: Indra, hero, you have set free the copious (waters) which were formerly arrested by Ahi, and which you have distributed; invogorated by hymns, you have cast down headlong the slave, conceiting himself immortal.

text.sanskrit: शुभ्रं नु ते शुष्मं वर्धयंतः शुभ्रं वज्रं बाह्वोर्दधानाः ।शुभ्रस्त्वमिंद्र वावृधानो अस्मे दासीर्विशः सूर्येण सह्याः ॥

translations.text: We are invigorating your brilliant strength (by our praises), and plural cing the thunderbolt in yourhands; do you,Indra, radiant, increasing in strenght, and (encouraged) by the sun, overpower, for our (good), the servile people.

text.sanskrit: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्स्वपीवृतं मायिनं क्षियंतं ।उतो अपो द्यां तस्तभ्वांसमहन्नहिं शूर वीर्येण ॥

translations.text: Indra, hero, you have slain by your prow the glorified Ahi, hidden privy in a cave, lurking in concealment, covered by the waters in which he was abiding, and arresting the rains in the sky.

translations.text: We glorify,Indra, your mighty (deeds) of old; we glorify your (more) recent exploits; we praise the thunderbolt shining in your arms, and we celebrate the horses, the signs of (Indra as) the sun.

translations.text: Your swift horses,Indra, have uttered a loud sound, announcing rain; the level earth anxiously expects its fall, as the gathering cloud has passed.

text.sanskrit: अरोरवीद्वृष्णो अस्य वज्रोऽमानुषं यन्मानुषो निजूर्वात् ।नि मायिनो दानवस्य माया अपादयत्पपिवान्त्सुतस्य ॥

translations.text: Drink, hero,Indra, drink theSoma;may the exhilarating juices delight you; may they, distending your flanks, augment (your prowess), and in this manner may the replenishing effused libation satisfy Indra.

text.sanskrit: त्वे इंद्राप्यभूम विप्रा धियं वनेम ऋतया सपंतः ।अवस्यवो धीमहि प्रशस्तिं सद्यस्ते रायो दावने स्याम ॥
text.iast: tve íti  indra  api  abhūma  víprāḥ  dhíyam  vanema  ṛta-yā  sapantaḥ avasyavaḥ  dhīmahi  pra-śastim  sadyaḥ  te  rāyaḥ  dāvane  syāma ||

translations.text: May we, your pious (worshipper), abide in you; approaching you with devotion, may we enjoy (the reward of) our adoration; desirous of protection, we meditate your glorification; may we ever be (thought worthy) of the gift of your treasures.

text.sanskrit: स्याम ते त इंद्र ये त ऊती अवस्यव ऊर्जं वर्धयंतः ।शुष्मिंतमं यं चाकनाम देवास्मे रयिं रासि वीरवंतं ॥

translations.text: May we, (through) your (favour),Indra, be such as those are, who, desirous of your protection, augment (by their praises) your vigour; divine (Indra), you grant the wealth which we desire, (the source of) great power and of (numerous) progeny.

text.sanskrit: व्यंत्विन्नु येषु मंदसानस्तृपत्सोमं पाहि द्रह्यदिंद्र ।अस्मान्त्सु पृत्स्वा तरुत्रावर्धयो द्यां बृहद्भिरर्कैः ॥

text.sanskrit: सनेम ये त ऊतिभिस्तरंतो विश्वाः स्पृध आर्येण दस्यून् ।अस्मभ्यं तत्त्वाष्ट्रं विश्वरूपमरंधयः साख्यस्य त्रिताय ॥

text.sanskrit: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिंद्र दक्षिणा मघोनी ।शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥

text.sanskrit: यो जात एव प्रथमो मनस्वांदेवो देवान्क्रतुना पर्यभूषत् ।यस्य शुष्माद्रोदसी अभ्यसेतां नृम्णस्य मह्ना स जनास इंद्रः ॥

translations.text: He, who as soon as born,is the first (of the deities); who has done honour to the gods by his exploits; he, at whose might heaven and earth are alarmed, and (who is known) by the greatness of his strength, he, men, isIndra.

text.sanskrit: यो हत्वाहिमरिणात्सप्त सिंधून्यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य ।यो अश्मनोरंतरग्निं जजान संवृक्समत्सु स जनास इंद्रः ॥

translations.text: He, who having destroyed Ahi, set free the seven rivers; who recovered the cows detained byBala; who genitive rated fire in the clouds; who is invincible in battle; he, men, isIndra.

text.sanskrit: येनेमा विश्वा च्यवना कृतानि यो दासं वर्णमधरं गुहाकः ।श्वघ्नीव यो जिगीवां लक्षमाददर्यः पुष्टानि स जनास इंद्रः ॥

text.sanskrit: यं स्मा पृच्छंति कुह सेति घोरमुतेमाहुर्नैषो अस्तीत्येनं ।सो अर्यः पुष्टीर्विज इवा मिनाति श्रदस्मै धत्त स जनास इंद्रः ॥

translations.text: He, whom, terrible, they ask for, (saying), Where is he? or, verily, they say of him, he is not (in any one plural ce); but who, inflicting (chastisement), destroys the cherisshed (treasures) of the enemy; in him have faith; for he, men, isIndra.

translations.text: He, under whose control are horses and cattle, and villages, and all chariots; he who gave birth to the sun and to the dawn; and who is the leader of the waters; he, men, isIndra.

text.sanskrit: यं क्रंदसी संयती विह्वयेते परेऽवर उभया अमित्राः ।समानं चिद्रथमातस्थिवांसा नाना हवेते स जनास इंद्रः ॥

translations.text: Whom (two hosts), calling and mutually encountering, call upon; whom both adversaries, high and low, (appeal to); whom two (charioteers), standing in the same car, severally invoke; he, men, isIndra.

text.sanskrit: यस्मान्न ऋते विजयंते जनासो यं युध्यमाना अवसे हवंते ।यो विश्वस्य प्रतिमानं बभूव यो अच्युतच्युत्स जनास इंद्रः ॥

translations.text: Without whom men do not conquer; whom, when engaged in conflict, they invoke for succour; he, who is the prototype of the universe and the caster down of the unyielding; he, men, isIndra.

text.sanskrit: यो नार्मरं सहवसुं निहंतवे पृक्षाय च दासवेशाय चावहः ।ऊर्जयंत्या अपरिविष्टमास्यमुतैवाद्य पुरुकृत्सास्युक्थ्यः ॥

translations.text: You, who are (famed for) many exploits, put on today an unclouded countenance, (as prepared) to slay Sahavasu, the son of Nṛmara, with the sharpened (edge of the thunderbolt), in defence of the (sacrificial) food, and for the destruction ofdasyu; you are he who is to be praised.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: शतं वा यस्य दश साकमाद्य एकस्य श्रुष्टौ यद्ध चोदमाविथ ।अरज्जौ दस्यून्त्समुनब्दभीतये सुप्राव्यो अभवः सास्युक्थ्यः ॥
text.iast: śatam  vā  yasya  daśa  sākam  ā  adyaḥ  ekasya  śruṣṭau  yat  ha  codam  āvitha arajjau  dasyūn  sam  unap  dabhītaye  supra-avyaḥ  abhavaḥ  saḥ  asi  ukthyaḥ ||

translations.text: You, for whose sole plural asure a thousand (steeds are ready); by whom all are to be fed; and who protects the instrumental tutor (of the sacrifice); who, for the sake ofDabhīti, has caste theDasyusinto unfettered (captivity), and who are to be approached (by all), you are he who is to be praised.

text.sanskrit: विश्वेदनु रोधना अस्य पौंस्यं ददुरस्मै दधिरे कृत्नवे धनं ।षळस्तभ्ना विष्टिरः पंच संदृशः परि परो अभवः सास्युक्थ्यः ॥
text.iast: víśvā  ít  anu  rodhanāḥ  asya  pauṃsyam  daduḥ  asmai  dadhire  kṛtnave  dhanam ṣaṭ  astabhnāḥ  vi-stíraḥ  pañca  sam-dṛśaḥ  pari  paraḥ  abhavaḥ  saḥ  asi  ukthyaḥ ||

translations.text: You are he, from whose manhood all the rivers (have proceeded); to whom (the pious) have given (offerings); to whom, doer of mighty deeds, they have presented wealth; you are he, who have regulated the six expansive (objects), and are the protector of the five (races), that look up to you; you are he who is to be praised.

text.sanskrit: सुप्रवाचनं तव वीर वीर्यं यदेकेन क्रतुना विंदसे वसु ।जातूष्ठिरस्य प्र वयः सहस्वतो या चकर्थ सेंद्र विश्वास्युक्थ्यः ॥
text.iast: su-pravācanam  tava  vīra  vīryam  yat  ekena  kratunā  vindase  vasu jātū-sthirasya  pra  vayaḥ  sahasvataḥ  yā  cakartha  saḥ  indra  víśvā  asi  ukthyaḥ ||

translations.text: Your heroism, hero, is to be glorified, by which, with single effort, you have acquired wealth; (wherewith) the (sacrificial) food of (every) solemn and constant (ceremony is provided); for all (the acts) you have performed, you,Indra, are he who is to be praised.

text.sanskrit: अरमयः सरपसस्तराय कं तुर्वीतये च वय्याय च स्रुतिं ।नीचा संतमुदनयः परावृजं प्रांधं श्रोणं श्रवयन्त्सास्युक्थ्यः ॥
text.iast: aramayaḥ  sara-apasaḥ  tarāya  kam  turvītaye  ca  vayyāya  ca  srutím nīcā  santam  ut  anayaḥ  parā-vṛjam  pra  andham  śroṇam  śravayan  saḥ  asi  ukthyaḥ ||

translations.text: You have provided a passage for the easy crossing of the flowing waters for Turvati andVayya; rendering (yourself) renowned, you have uplifted the blind and lame Paravṛj from the lowliness (of affliction); you are he who is to be praised.

translations.text: Possessor of riches, exert your ability to bestow wealth upon us; for yours is great affluence; may you,Indra, be disposed to grant us exceeding abundance day by day, so that, blessed with worthy descendants, we may glorify you at (our) sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो भरतेंद्राय सोममामत्रेभिः सिंचता मद्यमंधः ।कामी हि वीरः सदमस्य पीतिं जुहोत वृष्णे तदिदेष वष्टि ॥

translations.text: Priests, bring theSomalibation forIndra; sprinkle with ladles the exhilarating beverage; he, the hero, is ever desirous of the draught; offer the libation to the showerer (of benefits), for, verily, he desires it.

text.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो अपो वव्रिवांसं वृत्रं जघानाशन्येव वृक्षं ।तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशायँ एष इंद्रो अर्हति पीतिमस्य ॥
text.iast: adhvaryavaḥ  yaḥ  apaḥ  vavri-vāṃsam  vṛtram  jaghāna  aśanyā-iva  vṛkṣam tasmai  etam  bharata  tat-vaśāya  eṣaḥ  índraḥ  arhati  pītím  asya ||

translations.text: Priests, offer the libation to him who slew the rain-arrestingVṛtra, as (he strikes down) a tree with (his) thunderbolt; to him who desires it; andIndrais worthy of (Soma).

text.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो दृभीकं जघान यो गा उदाजदप हि वलं वः ।तस्मा एतमंतरिक्षे न वातमिंद्रं सोमैरोर्णुत जूर्न वस्त्रैः ॥
text.iast: adhvaryavaḥ  yaḥ  dṛbhīkam  jaghāna  yaḥ  gāḥ  ut-ājat  apa  hí  valam  varíti vaḥ tasmai  etam  antarikṣe  na  vātam  índram  somaiḥ  ā  ūrṇuta  jūḥ  na  vastraiḥ ||

translations.text: Priests, offer this libation, which, like the wind in the firmament, (is the cause of rain), to him who slew Dṛbhīka, destroyedBala, andliberated the cows; heapIndrawithSoma, as an old man (is covered) with garments.

translations.text: Priests, propitiate, by the offering of theSomathatIndra, who slewUraṇa, displaying nine and ninety arms; and hurledArbudadown headlong.

text.sanskrit: स प्रवोळ्हॄन्परिगत्या दभीतेर्विश्वमधागायुधमिद्धे अग्नौ ।सं गोभिरश्वैरसृजद्रथेभिः सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: saḥ  pra-voḷhṝn  pari-gatya  dabhīteḥ  víśvam  adhāk  āyudham  iddhe  agnau sam  gobhiḥ  aśvaiḥ  asṛjat  rathebhiḥ  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: Encountering the (asuras), carrying offDabhiti, he burnt all their weapons in a kindled fire, and enriched (the prince) with their cattle, their horses and their chariots; in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: स ईं महीं धुनिमेतोररम्णात्सो अस्नातॄनपारयत्स्वस्ति ।त उत्स्नाय रयिमभि प्र तस्थुः सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: saḥ  īm  mahīm  dhunim  etoḥ  aramṇāt  saḥ  asnātṝn  apārayat  svastí te  ut-snāya  rayím  abhí  pra  tasthuḥ  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: He tranquilized this great river, (so that it) might be crossed; he conveyed across it in safety (the sages) who had been unable to pass over it, and who, having crossed, proceeded to realize the wealthy they sought; in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: सोदंचं सिंधुमरिणान्महित्वा वज्रेणान उषसः सं पिपेष ।अजवसो जविनीभिर्विवृश्चन्त्सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: saḥ  udañcam  síndhum  ariṇāt  mahi-tvā  vajreṇa  anaḥ  uṣasaḥ  sam  pipeṣa ajavasaḥ  javínībhiḥ  vi-vṛścan  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: By his great power he turned theSindhutowards the north; with his thunderbolt he ground to pieces the wagon of the dawn, scattering the tardy enemy with his swift forces; in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: स विद्वाँ अपगोहं कनीनामाविर्भवन्नुदतिष्ठत्परावृक् ।प्रति श्रोणः स्थाद्व्यनगचष्ट सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: saḥ  vidvān  apa-goham  kanīnām  āvíḥ  bhavan  ut  atiṣṭhat  parā-vṛk prati  śroṇaḥ  sthāt  ví  anak  acaṣṭa  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: Conscious of the disappearance of the damsels, the (ṛṣi) Parivṛj, becoming manifest, stood up; the lame man overtook (them), the blind man beheld (them); in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: भिनद्वलमंगिरोभिर्गृणानो वि पर्वतस्य दृंहितान्यैरत् ।रिणग्रोधांसि कृत्रिमाण्येषां सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: bhinat  valam  aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ  gṛṇānaḥ  ví  parvatasya  dṛṃhitāni  airat riṇak  rodhāṃsi  kṛtrímāṇi  eṣām  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: Praised by theAṅgirasas, he destroyedBala; he forced upon the firmshut(doors) of the mountain; he broke down their artificial defences; in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: स्वप्नेनाभ्युप्या चुमुरिं धुनिं च जघंथ दस्युं प्र दभीतिमावः ।रंभी चिदत्र विविदे हिरण्यं सोमस्य ता मद इंद्रश्चकार ॥
text.iast: svapnena  abhi-upya  cumurim  dhunim  ca  jaghantha  dasyum  pra  dabhītim  āvaḥ rambhī  cit  atra  vivide  híraṇyam  somasya  tā  made  índraḥ  cakāra ||

translations.text: You have slain theDasyusCumuri andDhuni, having cast them into (profound) sleep; you have protectedDabhīti, while his chamberlain gained in that (contest) the gold (of theasuras); in the exhilaration of theSoma,Indrahas done these (deeds).

text.sanskrit: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिंद्र दक्षिणा मघोनी ।शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: nūnam  sā  te  prati  varam  jaritre  duhīyat  indra  dakṣiṇā  maghonī śíkṣa  stotṛ-bhyaḥ  mā  ati  dhak  bhagaḥ  naḥ  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: That opulent donation which proceeds,Indra, from you, assuredly bestows upon him who praises you the boon (that he desires); grant it to (us) your adorers; do not you, who are the object of adoration, disregard our prayers; so that, blessed with worthy descendants, we may glorify you at this sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: प्र वः सतां ज्येष्ठतमाय सुष्टुतिमग्नाविव समिधाने हविर्भरे ।इंद्रमजुर्यं जरयंतमुक्षितं सनाद्युवानमवसे हवामहे ॥
text.iast: pra  vaḥ  satām  jyeṣṭhatamāya  su-stutím  agnau-iva  sam-idhāne  havíḥ  bhare índram  ajuryam  jarayantam  ukṣitam  sanāt  yuvānam  avase  havāmahe ||

translations.text: I bear the libation for you to the best of the holy (gods, to be poured) on the kindled fire, (and I offer to him fitting praise); we invoke for (our) protection the ever-youthfulIndra, the undecaying, the causer of decay, sprinkled (with theSoma).

text.sanskrit: यस्मादिंद्राद्बृहतः किं चनेमृते विश्वान्यस्मिन्त्संभृताधि वीर्या ।जठरे सोमं तन्वी सहो महो हस्ते वज्रं भरति शीर्षणि क्रतुं ॥
text.iast: yasmāt  índrāt  bṛhataḥ  kím  cana  īm  ṛte  víśvāni  asmin  sam-bhṛtā  adhi  vīryā jaṭhare  somam  tanví  sahaḥ  mahaḥ  haste  vajram  bharati  śīrṣaṇi  kratum ||

translations.text: For without that mightyIndra, this (world) were nothing; in him all powers whatever are aggregated; he receives theSomainto his stomach, and in his body (exhibits) strength and energy; he bears the thunderbolt in hishand, and wisdom in his head.

text.sanskrit: न क्षोणीभ्यां परिभ्वे त इंद्रियं न समुद्रैः पर्वतैरिंद्र ते रथः ।न ते वज्रमन्वश्नोति कश्चन यदाशुभिः पतसि योजना पुरु ॥
text.iast: na  kṣoṇībhyām  pari-bhve  te  indriyam  na  samudraiḥ  parvataiḥ  indra  te  rathaḥ na  te  vajram  anu  aśnoti  kaḥ  cana  yat  āśu-bhiḥ  patasi  yojanā  puru ||

translations.text: Your might,Indra, is not to be overcome by (that of) heaven and earth; nor is your chariot (to be stopped) by oceans or by mountains; no one can escape from your thunderbolt, when you traverse many leagues with rapid (horses).

text.sanskrit: विश्वे ह्यस्मै यजताय धृष्णवे क्रतुं भरंति वृषभाय सश्चते ।वृषा यजस्व हविषा विदुष्टरः पिबेंद्र सोमं वृषभेण भानुना ॥
text.iast: víśve  hí  asmai  yajatāya  dhṛṣṇave  kratum  bharanti  vṛṣabhāya  saścate vṛṣā  yajasva  havíṣā  viduḥ-taraḥ  píba  indra  somam  vṛṣabheṇa  bhānunā ||

translations.text: All men offer worship to that adorable, powerful, and munificent (Indra), who is associated (with praise); therefore, (do you), who are liberal and most wise, worship him with oblations; and drink, Indra, theSoma, together with the Sun, the showerer (of benefits).

text.sanskrit: वृष्णः कोशः पवते मध्व ऊर्मिर्वृषभान्नाय वृषभाय पातवे ।वृषणाध्वर्यू वृषभासो अद्रयो वृषणं सोमं वृषभाय सुष्वति ॥
text.iast: vṛṣṇaḥ  kośaḥ  pavate  madhvaḥ  ūrmíḥ  vṛṣabha-annāya  vṛṣabhāya  pātave vṛṣaṇā  adhvaryū íti  vṛṣabhāsaḥ  adrayaḥ  vṛṣaṇam  somam  vṛṣabhāya  susvati ||

translations.text: The juice of the gratifying and exhilarating (Soma), the exciter (of) those who drink it, flows to the showerer (of benefits), the dispenser of food, for his beverage; the two priests, the sprinklers of the oblation; and the stones (that express the Soma), offer to the best (of the deities), the Soma, the shedder (of blessings).

text.sanskrit: वृषा ते वज्र उत ते वृषा रथो वृषणा हरी वृषभाण्यायुधा ।वृष्णो मदस्य वृषभ त्वमीशिष इंद्र सोमस्य वृषभस्य तृप्णुहि ॥
text.iast: vṛṣā  te  vajraḥ  uta  te  vṛṣā  rathaḥ  vṛṣaṇā  harī íti  vṛṣabhāṇi  āyudhā vṛṣṇaḥ  madasya  vṛṣabha  tvam  īśiṣe  índra  somasya  vṛṣabhasya  tṛpṇuhi ||

translations.text: Your thunderbolt,Indra, is the rainer (of bounties); your chariot, the showerer (of blessings); your two horses, the shedders (of desires); your weapons the diffusers (of wishes); you reign, showerer (of benefits), over the inebriatingSoma, the sprinkler (of delight); satiate yourself, Indra, with the good-diffusing Soma.

text.iast: pra  te  nāvam  na  samane  vacasyuvam  brahmaṇā  yāmi  savaneṣu  dadhṛṣiḥ kuvít  naḥ  asya  vacasaḥ  ni-bodhiṣat  índram  utsam  na  vasunaḥ  sicāmahe ||

translations.text: Victorious in battle, (through) your (favour) I approach you, who are gratified by praise, in sacred rites with prayer, as a boat (to bear me over misfortune); mayIndralisten attentively to these our words; we pour out libations to Indra, (who is a receptacle) of treasure, as a well (is of water).

text.iast: purā  sam-bādhāt  abhí  ā  vavṛtsva  naḥ  dhenuḥ  na  vatsam  yavasasya  pipyuṣī sakṛt  su  te  sumatí-bhiḥ  śatakrato íti śata-krato  sam  patnībhiḥ  na  vṛṣaṇaḥ  nasīmahi ||

translations.text: By his strength, he fixed the wandering mountains; he directed the downward course of the waters; he upheld the earth, the nurse (of all creatures); and by his craft he stopped the heaven from falling.

text.sanskrit: सास्मा अरं बाहुभ्यां यं पिताकृणोद्विश्वस्मादा जनुषो वेदसस्परि ।येना पृथिव्यां नि क्रिविं शयध्यै वज्रेण हत्व्यवृणक्तुविष्वणिः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  asmai  aram  bāhu-bhyām  yam  pitā  akṛṇot  víśvasmāt  ā  januṣaḥ  vedasaḥ  pari yena  pṛthivyām  ní  krívim  śayadhyai  vajreṇa  hatvī  avṛṇak  tuvi-svaniḥ ||

translations.text: Sufficient was he for (the protection of) this (world), which he, its defender, fabricated with his two arms for the sake of all mankind, over whom he was supreme by his wisdom; whereby, (also), he the loud-shouting, having struck Krivi (asura) with the thunderbolt, consigned him to (eternal) slumber on the earth.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अमाजूरिव पित्रोः सचा सती समानादा सदसस्त्वामिये भगं ।कृधि प्रकेतमुप मास्या भर दद्धि भागं तन्वो येन मामहः ॥
text.iast: amājūḥ-iva  pitroḥ  sacā  satī  samānāt  ā  sadasaḥ  tvām  iye  bhagam kṛdhí  pra-ketam  upa  māsi  ā  bhara  daddhí  bhāgam  tanvaḥ  yena  mamahaḥ ||

translations.text: As a virtuous (maiden), growing old in the same dwelling with her parents, (claims from them her support), so come I to you for wealth; make it conspicuous, measure it, bring it (hither), grant (a sufficient) portion for my bodily sustenance, (such as that) wherewith you honour (your worshippers).

translations.text: We invoke you,Indra, the bestower of enjoyment; you grant food, Indra, (in requital of pious) works; protect us, Indra, with manifold protections; Indra, showerer (of benefits), render us affluent.

translations.text: A laudable and pure sacrifice, has been instrumental tuted at dawn; having four pairs (of stones for bruising theSoma); three tones (of prayer); seven metres, and ten vessels; beneficial to man, conferring heaven, and sanctifiable with solemn rites and praises.

translations.text: That (sacrifice) is sufficient for him, (Indra), whether (offered) for the first, the second, or the third time; it is the bearer (of good) to man; other (priests) engender the embryo of a different (rite), but this victorious (sacrifice), the showerer (of benefits) combines with other (ceremonies).

translations.text: Come hither,Indra, (having heard) my prayer; yoke your two universal steeds to the pole of your chariot; you have been the object of invocation in many ways by many (worshippers), but now, hero, be exhilarated in this (our) sacrifice.

translations.text: Thus, hero, have theGṛtsamadas

text.sanskrit: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिंद्र दक्षिणा मघोनी ।शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: nūnam  sā  te  prati  varam  jaritre  duhīyat  indra  dakṣiṇā  maghonī śíkṣa  stotṛ-bhyaḥ  mā  ati  dhak  bhagaḥ  naḥ  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: That opulent donation which proceeds,Indra, from you, assuredly bestows upon him who praises you, the boon (that he desires); grant it to us yor adorers; do not you, who are the object of adoration, disregard our prayers; so that, blessed with worthy descendants, we may glorify you in this sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: वयं ते वय इंद्र विद्धि षु णः प्र भरामहे वाजयुर्न रथं ।विपन्यवो दीध्यतो मनीषा सुम्नमियक्षंतस्त्वावतो नॄन् ॥
text.iast: vayam  te  vayaḥ  indra  viddhí  su  naḥ  pra  bharāmahe  vāja-yuḥ  na  ratham vipanyavaḥ  dīdhyataḥ  manīṣā  sumnam  íyakṣantaḥ  tvā-vataḥ  nṝn ||

translations.text: We bring to you,Indra, (sacrificial) food, as one desiring food brings his wagon; regard us benevolently when glorifying you, rendering (you) illustrious by (our) praise, and soliciting such guides as you are to felicity.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वं न इंद्र त्वाभिरूती त्वायतो अभिष्टिपासि जनान् ।त्वमिनो दाशुषो वरूतेत्थाधीरभि यो नक्षति त्वा ॥
text.iast: tvam  naḥ  indra  tvābhiḥ  ūtī  tvā-yataḥ  abhiṣṭi-pā  asi  janān tvam  inaḥ  dāśuṣaḥ  varūtā  itthā-dhīḥ  abhí  yaḥ  nakṣati  tvā ||

translations.text: (Defend us),Indra, with your protections, for you are the defender against enemies of those men who rely upon you; you are the lord of the offerer (of the libation) and the repeller (of foes), and with these acts (protect) him who worships you.

text.sanskrit: स नो युवेंद्रो जोहूत्रः सखा शिवो नरामस्तु पाता ।यः शंसंतं यः शशमानमूती पचंतं च स्तुवंतं च प्रणेषत् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  naḥ  yuvā  índraḥ  johūtraḥ  sakhā  śivaḥ  narām  astu  pātā yaḥ  śaṃsantam  yaḥ  śaśamānam  ūtī  pacantam  ca  stuvantam  ca  pra-neṣat ||

translations.text: May that young, adorableIndra, ever be the friend, the benefactor, and protector of us, his worshipper; who, with his protection, may conduct (to the object of his worship) him who repeats (to him) prayer and praise, who prepares the oblation, and recites (his) commendations.

text.sanskrit: तमु स्तुष इंद्रं तं गृणीषे यस्मिन्पुरा वावृधुः शाशदुश्च ।स वस्वः कामं पीपरदियानो ब्रह्मण्यतो नूतनस्यायोः ॥
text.iast: tam  ūṃ íti  stuṣe  índram  tam  gṛṇīṣe  yasmin  purā  vavṛdhuḥ  śāśaduḥ  ca saḥ  vasvaḥ  kāmam  pīparat  iyānaḥ  brahmaṇyataḥ  nūtanasya  āyoḥ ||

translations.text: I laud thatIndra, I glorify him, in whom of old (his worshippers) prospered, and overcame (their enemies); may he, when solicited, gratify the desire of wealth of his present pious adorer.

text.sanskrit: सो अंगिरसामुचथा जुजुष्वान्ब्रह्मा तूतोदिंद्रो गातुमिष्णन् ।मुष्णन्नुषसः सूर्येण स्तवानश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पूर्व्याणि ॥
text.iast: saḥ  aṅgirasām  ucathā  jujuṣvān  brahmā  tūtot  índraḥ  gātum  iṣṇan muṣṇan  uṣasaḥ  sūryeṇa  stavān  aśnasya  cit  śiśnathat  pūrvyāṇi ||

translations.text: Propitiated by the hymns of theAṅgirasas,Indragranted their prayer, and directed them on the way (to recover their cattle); carrying off the dawns by the (light of the) sun, he, animated by praise, demolished the ancient cities of Aśna.

text.sanskrit: स ह श्रुत इंद्रो नाम देव ऊर्ध्वो भुवन्मनुषे दस्मतमः ।अव प्रियमर्शसानस्य साह्वांछिरो भरद्दासस्य स्वधावान् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  ha  śrutaḥ  índraḥ  nāma  devaḥ  ūrdhvaḥ  bhuvat  manuṣe  dasma-tamaḥ ava  priyam  arśasānasya  sahvān  śíraḥ  bharat  dāsasya  svadhā-vān ||

translations.text: May the renowned and gracefulIndra, who is verily divine, be present over men; may he, the vigorous conqueror of foes, cast down the precious head of the malignantDāsa.

text.sanskrit: स वृत्रहेंद्रः कृष्णयोनीः पुरंदरो दासीरैरयद्वि ।अजनयन्मनवे क्षामपश्च सत्रा शंसं यजमानस्य तूतोत् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  vṛtra-hā  índraḥ  kṛṣṇa-yonīḥ  puram-daraḥ  dāsīḥ  airayat  ví ajanayat  manave  kṣām  apaḥ  ca  satrā  śaṃsam  yajamānasya  tūtot ||

translations.text: Indra, the slayer ofVṛtra, the destroyer of cities, has scattered the black-sprung servile (hosts); he engendered the earth and the waters forManu; may he fulfill the entire prayer of the sacrificer.

text.sanskrit: तस्मै तवस्यमनु दायि सत्रेंद्राय देवेभिरर्णसातौ ।प्रति यदस्य वज्रं बाह्वोर्धुर्हत्वी दस्यून्पुर आयसीर्नि तारीत् ॥

translations.text: Vigour has been perpetually imparted toIndraby his worshippers (with oblations), for the sake of obtaining rain; for which purpose they have plural ced the thunderbolt in hishands, wherewith,having slain theDasyus, he has destroyed their metal cities.

text.sanskrit: सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः ।वृतंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इंद्रस्य वोचं प्र कृतानि वीर्या ॥
text.iast: satrā-sahaḥ  jana-bhakṣaḥ  janam-sahaḥ  cyavanaḥ  yudhmaḥ  anu  joṣam  ukṣitaḥ vṛtam-cayaḥ  sahuriḥ  vikṣu  āritaḥ  índrasya  vocam  pra  kṛtāni  vīryā ||

translations.text: I proclaim the mighty exploits of thatIndra, who is, ever victorious; the benefactor of man, the overthrower of (the strong) man, the caster down (of foes), the warrior, who is gratified by our libations, the granter of desires, the subduer of enemies, the refuge of the people.

text.sanskrit: अनानुदो वृषभो दोधतो वधो गंभीर ऋष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः ।रध्रचोदः श्नथनो वीळितस्पृथुरिंद्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः स्वर्जनत् ॥
text.iast: ananu-daḥ  vṛṣabhaḥ  dodhataḥ  vadhaḥ  gambhīraḥ  ṛṣvaḥ  asamaṣṭa-kāvyaḥ radhra-codaḥ  śnathanaḥ  vīḷitaḥ  pṛthuḥ  índraḥ  su-yajñaḥ  uṣasaḥ  svaḥ  janat ||

translations.text: Unequalled in liberty, the showerer (of benefits), the slayer of the malevolent, profound, mighty, (endowed with) impenetrable sagacity, the dispenser of prosperity, the enfeebler (of foes), firm (of frame), vast (in bulk) the performer of pious acts,Indrahas given birth to the light of the morning.

text.sanskrit: यज्ञेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः ।अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इंद्रे हिन्वाना द्रविणान्याशत ॥
text.iast: yajñena  gātum  ap-turaḥ  vividrire  dhíyaḥ  hinvānāḥ  uśíjaḥ  manīṣíṇaḥ abhi-svarā  ni-sadā  gāḥ  avasyavaḥ  índre  hinvānāḥ  draviṇāni  āśata ||

translations.text: The wiseUśijas, celebrating his praises, have obtained by their sacrifice, from the sender of water (knowledge) of the path (of their cattle); seeking the aid ofIndra, and celebrating his praises, they have acquired, whilst uttering hymns and offering adoration (valuable) treasures.

text.sanskrit: इंद्र श्रेष्ठानि द्रविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वमस्मे ।पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां स्वाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नां ॥

text.sanskrit: त्रिकद्रुकेषु महिषो यवाशिरं तुविशुष्मस्तृपत्सोममपिबद्विष्णुना सुतं यथावशत् ।स ईं ममाद महि कर्म कर्तवे महामुरुं सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिंद्रं सत्य इंदुः ॥
text.iast: trí-kadrukeṣu  mahiṣaḥ  yava-āśiram  tuvi-śuṣmaḥ  tṛpat  somam  apibat  víṣṇunā  sutam  yathā  avaśat saḥ  īm  mamāda  mahi  karma  kartave  mahām  urum  saḥ  enam  saścat  devaḥ  devam  satyam  índram  satyaḥ  índuḥ ||

translations.text: The adorable and powerful (Indra), partaking of theSoma, mixed with barley, effused at the Tṛkadruka rites, has drunk withViṣṇuas much as he wished; the draught has excited that great and mighty Indra to perform great deeds; may that divine (Soma) pervade the divine (Indra), the true Soma (pervade) the true Indra.

text.sanskrit: अध त्विषीमाँ अभ्योजसा क्रिविं युधाभवदा रोदसी अपृणदस्य मज्मना प्र वावृधे ।अधत्तान्यं जठरे प्रेमरिच्यत सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिंद्रं सत्य इंदुः ॥
text.iast: adha  tvíṣi-mān  abhí  ojasā  krívim  yudhā  abhavat  ā  rodasī íti  apṛṇat  asya  majmanā  pra  vavṛdhe adhatta  anyam  jaṭhare  pra  īm  aricyata  saḥ  enam  saścat  devaḥ  devam  satyam  índram  satyaḥ  índuḥ ||

translations.text: Thereupon, resplendent, he has overcome Krivi in conflict by his prowess;he has filled heaven and earth (with his lustre), and has been invigorated by the efficacy of the draught; one portion he has taken to himself; the other he has distributed (to the gods); may that divine (Soma) pervade the divine (Indra), the true Soma, the true (Indra).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: साकं जातः क्रतुना साकमोजसा ववक्षिथ साकं वृद्धो वीर्यैः सासहिर्मृधो विचर्षणिः ।दाता राधः स्तुवते काम्यं वसु सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिंद्रं सत्य इंदुः ॥
text.iast: sākam  jātaḥ  kratunā  sākam  ojasā  vavakṣitha  sākam  vṛddhaḥ  vīryaiḥ  sasahíḥ  mṛdhaḥ  ví-carṣaṇiḥ dātā  rādhaḥ  stuvate  kāmyam  vasu  saḥ  enam  saścat  devaḥ  devam  satyam  índram  satyaḥ  índuḥ ||

translations.text: Cognate with (pious) works and with power, you desire to support (the universe); mighty with heroic (energies); you are the subduer of the malevolent; (you are) the distinguisher (between the doer of good and ill); the giver of the substantial wealth he desires to him who praises you; may the divine (Soma) pervade the divine (Indra), the true Soma, the true (Indra).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तव त्यन्नर्यं नृतोऽप इंद्र प्रथमं पूर्व्यं दिवि प्रवाच्यं कृतं ।यद्देवस्य शवसा प्रारिणा असुं रिणन्नपः ।भुवद्विश्वमभ्यादेवमोजसा विदादूर्जं शतक्रतुर्विदादिषं ॥
text.iast: tava  tyat  naryam  nṛto íti  apaḥ  indra  prathamam  pūrvyam  diví  pra-vācyam  kṛtam yat  devasya  śavasā  pra  ariṇāḥ  asum  riṇan  apaḥ bhuvat  víśvam  abhí  adevam  ojasā  vidāt  ūrjam  śata-kratuḥ  vidāt  íṣam ||

translations.text: Indra, the delighter (of all), the first act performed by you in ancient time was for the good of man, and deserving of renown in heaven, when, arresting by force the breath of the (enemy) of the gods, you did send down the rain; may Indra prevail by his prowess over all that is godless; mayŚatakratuobtain vigour; may he obtain (sacrificial) food.

text.sanskrit: गणानां त्वा गणपतिं हवामहे कविं कवीनामुपमश्रवस्तमं ।ज्येष्ठराजं ब्रह्मणां ब्रह्मणस्पत आ नः शृण्वन्नूतिभिः सीद सादनं ॥
text.iast: gaṇānām  tvā  gaṇa-patim  havāmahe  kavím  kavīnām  upamaśravaḥ-tamam jyeṣṭha-rājam  brahmaṇām  brahmaṇaḥ  pate  ā  naḥ  śṛṇvan  ūtí-bhiḥ  sīda  sadanam ||

translations.text: We invoke theBrahmaṇaspati, chief leaderof the (heavenly) bands; a sage of sage; aboundingbeyondmeasure in (every kind of) food;best lord of prayer; hearing our invocations, come with your protections, and sit down in the chamber of sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: देवाश्चित्ते असुर्य प्रचेतसो बृहस्पते यज्ञियं भागमानशुः ।उस्रा इव सूर्यो ज्योतिषा महो विश्वेषामिज्जनिता ब्रह्मणामसि ॥
text.iast: devāḥ  cit  te  asurya  pra-cetasaḥ  bṛhaspate  yajñíyam  bhāgam  ānaśuḥ usrāḥ-iva  sūryaḥ  jyotiṣā  mahaḥ  víśveṣām  ít  janitā  brahmaṇām  asi ||

translations.text: Bṛhaspati, destroyer of theasuras, through you the intelligent gods have obtained the sacrificialportion; in like manner as the adorable sun genitive rates the (solar) rays by his radiance, so are you the genitive rator of all prayers.

text.sanskrit: आ विबाध्या परिरापस्तमांसि च ज्योतिष्मंतं रथमृतस्य तिष्ठसि ।बृहस्पते भीमममित्रदंभनं रक्षोहणं गोत्रभिदं स्वर्विदं ॥
text.iast: ā  vi-bādhya  pari-rapaḥ  tamāṃsi  ca  jyotiṣmantam  ratham  ṛtasya  tiṣṭhasi bṛhaspate  bhīmam  amitra-dambhanam  rakṣaḥ-hanam  gotra-bhídam  svaḥ-vídam ||

text.sanskrit: सुनीतिभिर्नयसि त्रायसे जनं यस्तुभ्यं दाशान्न तमंहो अश्नवत् ।ब्रह्मद्विषस्तपनो मन्युमीरसि बृहस्पते महि तत्ते महित्वनं ॥
text.iast: sunītí-bhiḥ  nayasi  trāyase  janam  yaḥ  tubhyam  dāśāt  na  tam  aṃhaḥ  aśnavat brahma-dvíṣaḥ  tapanaḥ  manyu-mīḥ  asi  bṛhaspate  mahi  tat  te  mahi-tvanam ||

translations.text: You lead men,Bṛhaspati, by virtuous instrumental uctions; you preserve them (from calamity); sin will never overtake him who presents (offerings) to you; you are the afflicter of him who hates (holy) prayers; you are the punisher of wrath; such is your great mightiness.

text.sanskrit: न तमंहो न दुरितं कुतश्चन नारातयस्तितिरुर्न द्वयाविनः ।विश्वा इदस्माद्ध्वरसो वि बाधसे यं सुगोपा रक्षसि ब्रह्मणस्पते ॥
text.iast: na  tam  aṃhaḥ  na  duḥ-itam  kutaḥ  cana  na  arātayaḥ  titiruḥ  na  dvayāvínaḥ víśvāḥ  ít  asmāt  dhvarasaḥ  ví  bādhase  yam  su-gopāḥ  rakṣasi  brahmaṇaḥ  pate ||

translations.text: The man whom you,Brahmaṇaspati, a kind protector, defend, neither sorrow nor sin, nor adversaries nor dissemblers ever harm, for you drive away from him all injurious (things).

text.sanskrit: त्वं नो गोपाः पथिकृद्विचक्षणस्तव व्रताय मतिभिर्जरामहे ।बृहस्पते यो नो अभि ह्वरो दधे स्वा तं मर्मर्तु दुच्छुना हरस्वती ॥
text.iast: tvam  naḥ  gopāḥ  pathi-kṛt  vi-cakṣaṇaḥ  tava  vratāya  matí-bhiḥ  jarāmahe bṛhaspate  yaḥ  naḥ  abhí  hvaraḥ  dadhe  svā  tam  marmartu  ducchunā  harasvatī ||

translations.text: You,Bṛhaspati, are our protector and the guide of (our) path; (you are) the discerner (of all things); we worship with praises for your adoration; may his own precipitate malice involve him (in destruction) who practises deceit against us.

text.sanskrit: उत वा यो नो मर्चयादनागसोऽरातीवा मर्तः सानुको वृकः ।बृहस्पते अप तं वर्तया पथः सुगं नो अस्यै देववीतये कृधि ॥
text.iast: uta  vā  yaḥ  naḥ  marcayāt  anāgasaḥ  arāti-vā  martaḥ  sānukaḥ  vṛkaḥ bṛhaspate  apa  tam  vartaya  pathaḥ  su-gam  naḥ  asyai  deva-vītaye  kṛdhi ||

translations.text: Turn aside from (the true) path,Bṛhaspati, the arrogant and savage man who advances to injure us, although unoffending and keep us in the right way for (the completion of) this offering to the gods.

text.sanskrit: त्रातारं त्वा तनूनां हवामहेऽवस्पर्तरधिवक्तारमस्मयुं ।बृहस्पते देवनिदो नि बर्हय मा दुरेवा उत्तरं सुम्नमुन्नशन् ॥
text.iast: trātāram  tvā  tanūnām  havāmahe  ava-spartaḥ  adhi-vaktāram  asmayum bṛhaspate  deva-nídaḥ  ní  barhaya  mā  duḥ-evāḥ  ut-taram  sumnam  ut  naśan ||

translations.text: Bṛhaspati, defender (from calamity), we invoke you, the protector of our person ns, the speaker of encouraging words and well disposed towards us; do you destroy the revilers of the gods; let not the malevolent attain supreme felicity.

text.sanskrit: त्वया वयं सुवृधा ब्रह्मणस्पते स्पार्हा वसु मनुष्या ददीमहि ।या नो दूरे तळितो या अरातयोऽभि संति जंभया ता अनप्नसः ॥
text.iast: tvayā  vayam  su-vṛdhā  brahmaṇaḥ  pate  spārhā  vasu  manuṣyā  ā  dadīmahi yāḥ  naḥ  dūre  taḷítaḥ  yāḥ  arātayaḥ  abhí  santi  jambhaya  tāḥ  anapnasaḥ ||

text.sanskrit: त्वया वयमुत्तमं धीमहे वयो बृहस्पते पप्रिणा सस्निना युजा ।मा नो दुःशंसो अभिदिप्सुरीशत प्र सुशंसा मतिभिस्तारिषीमहि ॥
text.iast: tvayā  vayam  ut-tamam  dhīmahe  vayaḥ  bṛhaspate  papriṇā  sasninā  yujā mā  naḥ  duḥ-śaṃsaḥ  abhi-dipsuḥ  īśata  pra  su-śaṃsāḥ  matí-bhiḥ  tāriṣīmahi ||

translations.text: Through you,Bṛhaspati, (who are) the fulfiller of our desires; pure, and associated (with us), we possess excellent food; let not the wicked man who wishes to deceive us be our master; but let us, excelling in (pious) praises, attain (prosperity).

text.sanskrit: अनानुदो वृषभो जग्मिराहवं निष्टप्ता शत्रुं पृतनासु सासहिः ।असि सत्य ऋणया ब्रह्मणस्पत उग्रस्य चिद्दमिता वीळुहर्षिणः ॥
text.iast: ananu-daḥ  vṛṣabhaḥ  jagmiḥ  ā-havam  níḥ-taptā  śatrum  pṛtanāsu  sasahíḥ asi  satyaḥ  ṛṇa-yāḥ  brahmaṇaḥ  pate  ugrasya  cit  damitā  vīḷu-harṣíṇaḥ ||

translations.text: You,Brahmaṇaspati, who have no requiter (of your bounty), who are the showerer (of benefits), the repairer to combat, the consumer of foes, the victor in battles, you are true, the discharger of debts, the humiliator of the fierce and of the exulting.

translations.text: Bṛhaspatiis to be invoked in battles; he is to be approached with reverence; he who moves amidst combats, the distributor of repeated wealth; the lord Bṛhaspati has verily overturned all the assailing malignant (hosts), like chariots (overturned in battle).

text.sanskrit: तेजिष्ठया तपनी रक्षसस्तप ये त्वा निदे दधिरे दृष्टवीर्यं ।आविस्तत्कृष्व यदसत्त उक्थ्यंबृहस्पते वि परिरापो अर्दय ॥

text.sanskrit: मा नः स्तेनेभ्यो ये अभि द्रुहस्पदे निरामिणो रिपवोऽन्नेषु जागृधुः ।आ देवानामोहते वि व्रयो हृदि बृहस्पते न परः साम्नो विदुः ॥
text.iast: mā  naḥ  stenebhyaḥ  ye  abhí  druhaḥ  pade  nirāmíṇaḥ  ripavaḥ  anneṣu  jagṛdhuḥ ā  devānām  ohate  ví  vrayaḥ  hṛdí  bṛhaspate  na  paraḥ  sāmnaḥ  viduḥ ||

text.sanskrit: सेमामविड्ढि प्रभृतिं य ईशिषेऽया विधेम नवया महा गिरा ।यथा नो मीढ्वान्स्तवते सखा तव बृहस्पते सीषधः सोत नो मतिं ॥
text.iast: saḥ  imām  aviḍḍhi  pra-bhṛtim  yaḥ  īśiṣe  ayā  vidhema  navayā  mahā  girā yathā  naḥ  mīḍhvān  stavate  sakhā  tava  bṛhaspate  sīsadhaḥ  saḥ  uta  naḥ  matím ||

translations.text: Inasmuch,Bṛhaspati, as you rule (over all), accept this our propitiation; we worship you with this new and solemn hymn; since this your friend, our benefactor, celebrates you, do you fulfil our desires.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यो नंत्वान्यनमन्न्योजसोतादर्दर्मन्युना शंबराणि वि ।प्राच्यावयदच्युता ब्रह्मणस्पतिरा चाविशद्वसुमंतं वि पर्वतं ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  nantvāni  anamat  ní  ojasā  uta  adardaḥ  manyunā  śambarāṇi  ví pra  acyavayat  acyutā  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ  ā  ca  aviśat  vasu-mantam  ví  parvatam ||

translations.text: (You are) thatBrahmaṇaspatiwho, by his might, has humbled those who deserved humiliation; who in his wrath rent the clouds asunder; who sent down the undescending (waters); and made way into the mountain (cave), opulent (in cattle).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तद्देवानां देवतमाय कर्त्वमश्रथ्नंदृळ्हाव्रदंत वीळिता ।उद्गा आजदभिनद्ब्रह्मणा वलमगूहत्तमो व्यचक्षयत्स्वः ॥
text.iast: tat  devānām  deva-tamāya  kartvam  aśrathnan  dṛḷhā  avradanta  vīḷitā ut  gāḥ  ājat  abhinat  brahmaṇā  valam  agūhat  tamaḥ  ví  acakṣayat  svaríti svaḥ ||

translations.text: That was the exploit, (performed) for the most divine of the gods, by which the firm (shutgates) were thrown open, the strong (barriers) were relaxed, (by him) who set the cows at liberty; who, by the (force of the) sacred prayer, destroyedBalawho dispersed the darkness and displayed the light.

text.sanskrit: अश्मास्यमवतं ब्रह्मणस्पतिर्मधुधारमभि यमोजसातृणत् ।तमेव विश्वे पपिरे स्वर्दृशो बहु साकं सिसिचुरुत्समुद्रिणं ॥
text.iast: aśma-āsyam  avatam  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ  madhu-dhāram  abhí  yam  ojasā  atṛṇat tam  eva  víśve  papire  svaḥ-dṛśaḥ  bahu  sākam  sisicuḥ  utsam  udríṇam ||

translations.text: That stone-like, solid, down-hanging, water-laden (cloud), whichBrahmaṇaspatihas with his strength divided, the universal solar rays have drunk up; but they have again shed together the showering and water-spreading (rain).

text.sanskrit: सना ता का चिद्भुवना भवीत्वा माद्भिः शरद्भिर्दुरो वरंत वः ।अयतंता चरतो अन्यदन्यदिद्या चकार वयुना ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: sanā  tā  kā  cit  bhuvanā  bhavītvā  māt-bhíḥ  śarat-bhiḥ  duraḥ  varanta  vaḥ ayatantā  carataḥ  anyat-anyat  ít  yā  cakāra  vayunā  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: For you, (worshipper), the constant and manifold (bounties ofBrahmaṇaspati), through months and through years, set open the gates of the future rains, and he has appointed those results of prayer, which the two regions mutually and without effort provide.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अभिनक्षंतो अभि ये तमानशुर्निधिं पणीनां परमं गुहा हितं ।ते विद्वांसः प्रतिचक्ष्यानृता पुनर्यत उ आयंतदुदीयुराविशं ॥
text.iast: abhi-nakṣantaḥ  abhí  ye  tam  ānaśuḥ  ni-dhím  paṇīnām  paramam  guhā  hitam te  vidvāṃsaḥ  prati-cakṣya  anṛtā  punaḥ  yataḥ  ūṃ íti  āyan  tat  ut  īyuḥ  ā-víśam ||

translations.text: Those sages, who searching on every side, discovered the precious treasure (of cattle) hidden in the cave of thePaṇis, having seen through the false (illusions of theasura), and again coming (thither) forced an entrance.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ऋतावानः प्रतिचक्ष्यानृता पुनरात आ तस्थुः कवयो महस्पथः ।ते बाहुभ्यां धमितमग्निमश्मनि नकिः षो अस्त्यरणो जहुर्हि तं ॥
text.iast: ṛta-vānaḥ  prati-cakṣya  anṛtā  punaḥ  ā  ataḥ  ā  tasthuḥ  kavayaḥ  mahaḥ  pathaḥ te  bāhu-bhyām  dhamitam  agnim  aśmani  nakiḥ  saḥ  asti  araṇaḥ  jahuḥ  hí  tam ||

translations.text: Those sages, eminent for truth, having seen through the false (illusions of theasura), again pursued the main road thither, and with theirhandscast against the rock the destructive fire, which, till then, was not there.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ऋतज्येन क्षिप्रेण ब्रह्मणस्पतिर्यत्र वष्टि प्र तदश्नोति धन्वना ।तस्य साध्वीरिषवो याभिरस्यति नृचक्षसो दृशये कर्णयोनयः ॥
text.iast: ṛta-jyena  kṣipreṇa  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ  yatra  vaṣṭi  pra  tat  aśnoti  dhanvanā tasya  sādhvīḥ  íṣavaḥ  yābhiḥ  asyati  nṛ-cakṣasaḥ  dṛśaye  karṇa-yonayaḥ ||

translations.text: WhateverBrahmaṇaspatiaims at with the truth-strung quick-darting bow, that (mark) he surely attains; holy are its arrows with which he shoots (intended) for the eyes of men, and having their abode in the ear.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स संनयः स विनयः पुरोहितः स सुष्टुतः स युधि ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ।चाक्ष्मो यद्वाजं भरते मती धनादित्सूर्यस्तपति तप्यतुर्वृथा ॥
text.iast: saḥ  sam-nayaḥ  saḥ  vi-nayaḥ  puraḥ-hitaḥ  saḥ  su-stutaḥ  saḥ  yudhí  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ cākṣmaḥ  yat  vājam  bharate  matī  dhanā  āt  ít  sūryaḥ  tapati  tapyatuḥ  vṛthā ||

translations.text: He,Brahmaṇaspati, is the aggregator and subjugator (of objects); the family priest (of the gods) and the renowned in battle; the beholder (of all), who bestows food and desired treasures, whence the radiant sun shines without exertion.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: विभु प्रभु प्रथमं मेहनावतो बृहस्पतेः सुविदत्राणि राध्या ।इमा सातानि वेन्यस्य वाजिनो येन जना उभये भुंजते विशः ॥
text.iast: vi-bhu  pra-bhu  prathamam  mehanā-vataḥ  bṛhaspateḥ  su-vidatrāṇi  rādhyā imā  sātāni  venyasya  vājínaḥ  yena  janāḥ  ubhaye  bhuñjate  víśaḥ ||

translations.text: Expansive, vast, and excellent riches, are the attainable (bounties) ofBṛhaspati, the sender of the rain; these are the gifts of the adorable giver of food, whereby both (descriptions of worshippers) entering here enjoy (abundance).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: योऽवरे वृजने विश्वथा विभुर्महामु रण्वः शवसा ववक्षिथ ।स देवो देवान्प्रति पप्रथे पृथु विश्वेदु ता परिभूर्ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  avare  vṛjane  viśva-thā  vi-bhuḥ  mahām  ūṃ íti  raṇvaḥ  śavasā  vavakṣitha saḥ  devaḥ  devān  prati  paprathe  pṛthu  víśvā  ít  ūṃ íti  tā  pari-bhūḥ  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: He, who is all-pervading and delighting, is willing to sustain by his strength the noble, worshipper, as well as one who is in low distress; greatly is thatBrahmaṇaspatirenowned amongst the gods, and therefore is he verily supreme above all (beings).

text.sanskrit: विश्वं सत्यं मघवाना युवोरिदापश्चन प्र मिनंति व्रतं वां ।अच्छेंद्राब्रह्मणस्पती हविर्नोऽन्नं युजेव वाजिना जिगातं ॥
text.iast: víśvam  satyam  magha-vānā  yuvoḥ  ít  āpaḥ  cana  pra  minanti  vratam  vām accha  indrābrahmaṇaspatī íti  havíḥ  naḥ  annam  yujā-iva  vājínā  jigātam ||

translations.text: All truth, lords of wealth, (IndraandBrahmaṇaspati), is (inherent) in you both; the waters injure not your rites; come to our presence (to receive) our oblations, like a pair of steeds (to receive) their provender.

text.sanskrit: उताशिष्ठा अनु शृण्वंति वह्नयः सभेयो विप्रो भरते मती धना ।वीळुद्वेषा अनु वश ऋणमाददिः स ह वाजी समिथे ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: uta  āśiṣṭhāḥ  anu  śṛṇvanti  vahnayaḥ  sabheyaḥ  vípraḥ  bharate  matī  dhanā vīḷu-dveṣāḥ  anu  vaśā  ṛṇam  ā-dadíḥ  saḥ  ha  vājī  sam-ithe  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: The very swift horses (ofBrahmaṇaspati) listen to (our invocation); the priest of the assembly offers with praise the (sacrificial) wealth; may Brahmaṇaspati, the hater of the oppressor, accept (the payment of) the debt, agreeably to his plural asure; may he be the accepter of the (sacrificial) food presented at this ceremony.

text.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणस्पतेरभवद्यथावशं सत्यो मन्युर्महि कर्मा करिष्यतः ।यो गा उदाजत्स दिवे वि चाभजन्महीव रीतिः शवसासरत्पृथक् ॥
text.iast: brahmaṇaḥ  pateḥ  abhavat  yathā-vaśam  satyaḥ  manyuḥ  mahi  karma  kariṣyataḥ yaḥ  gāḥ  ut-ājat  saḥ  dive  ví  ca  abhajat  mahī-iva  rītíḥ  śavasā  asarat  pṛthak ||

translations.text: The purpose ofBrahmaṇaspati, engaging in a great work, has been successful, according to his wish; for he it was who recovered (the stolen) cattle for (the dwellers in) heaven; and distrubuted them; so that of their own power they took different directions, like (the branches of) a mighty river.

text.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणस्पते सुयमस्य विश्वहा रायः स्याम रथ्यो वयस्वतः ।वीरेषु वीराँ उप पृङ्धि नस्त्वं यदीशानो ब्रह्मणा वेषि मे हवं ॥
text.iast: brahmaṇaḥ  pate  su-yamasya  viśvahā  rāyaḥ  syāma  rathyaḥ  vayasvataḥ vīreṣu  vīrān  upa  pṛṅdhi  naḥ  tvam  yat  īśānaḥ  brahmaṇā  veṣi  me  havam ||

translations.text: May we,Brahmaṇaspati, be daily in the possession of well-regulated and food-supplying wealth; do you add for us posterity to posterity, since you, who are the ruler (of all) accept my invocation with (offered sacrificial) food.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणस्पते त्वमस्य यंता सूक्तस्य बोधि तनयं च जिन्व ।विश्वं तद्भद्रं यदवंति देवा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: brahmaṇaḥ  pate  tvam  asya  yantā  su-uktasya  bodhi  tanayam  ca  jinva víśvam  tat  bhadram  yat  avanti  devāḥ  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: Brahmaṇaspati, who are the regulator of this (world), understand (the purport of) our hymn, and grant us posterity; for all is prosperous that the gods protect; (and therefore) may we, blessed with excellent descendants, glorify you at this sacrifice.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इंधानो अग्निं वनवद्वनुष्यतः कृतब्रह्मा शूशुवद्रातहव्य इत् ।जातेन जातमति स प्र सर्सृते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: índhānaḥ  agnim  vanavat  vanuṣyataḥ  kṛta-brahmā  śūśuvat  rāta-havyaḥ  ít jātena  jātam  ati  saḥ  pra  sarsṛte  yam-yam  yujam  kṛṇute  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: Kindling the fire, may (the worshipper) overcome the malevolent (disturbers of the rite); may he, repeating prayers, and laden with oblations, prosper; he whomBrahmaṇaspatimakes his associates, lives to behold the son of his son.

text.sanskrit: वीरेभिर्वीरान्वनवद्वनुष्यतो गोभी रयिं पप्रथद्बोधति त्मना ।तोकं च तस्य तनयं च वर्धते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: vīrebhiḥ  vīrān  vanavat  vanuṣyataḥ  gobhiḥ  rayím  paprathat  bodhati  tmanā tokam  ca  tasya  tanayam  ca  vardhate  yam-yam  yujam  kṛṇute  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: (Surrounded) by his descendants, may hesurpasthe malevolent descendants (of his adversaries), for he is famed for great wealth of cattle, and understands (all things) of himself; his sons and grandsons prosper whomBrahmaṇaspatimakes his associate.

text.sanskrit: सिंधुर्न क्षोदः शिमीवाँ ऋघायतो वृषेव वध्रीँरभि वष्ट्योजसा ।अग्नेरिव प्रसितिर्नाह वर्तवे यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: síndhuḥ  na  kṣodaḥ  śímī-vān  ṛghāyataḥ  vṛṣā-iva  vadhrīn  abhí  vaṣṭi  ojasā agneḥ-iva  pra-sitiḥ  na  aha  vartave  yam-yam  yujam  kṛṇute  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: As a river (washes away) its banks, so the devout worshipper, (ofBrahmaṇaspati), overpowers his enemies by his strength, as a bull (overcomes) an ox; like the spreading flame of fire, it is impossible to stop him, whom Brahmaṇaspati makes his associate.

text.sanskrit: तस्मा अर्षंति दिव्या असश्चतः स सत्वभिः प्रथमो गोषु गच्छति ।अनिभृष्टतविषिर्हंत्योजसा यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: tasmai  arṣanti  divyāḥ  asaścataḥ  saḥ  satva-bhiḥ  prathamaḥ  goṣu  gacchati anibhṛṣṭa-taviṣiḥ  hanti  ojasā  yam-yam  yujam  kṛṇute  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: For him, the unobstructed rains of heaven descend; first among the devout, he acqires (wealth) in cattle; of irresistible vigour, he destroys his enemies by his strength, whomBrahmaṇaspatimakes his associate.

text.sanskrit: तस्मा इद्विश्वे धुनयंत सिंधवोऽच्छिद्रा शर्म दधिरे पुरूणि ।देवानां सुम्ने सुभगः स एधते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ॥
text.iast: tasmai  ít  víśve  dhunayanta  síndhavaḥ  acchidrā  śarma  dadhire  purūṇi devānām  sumne  su-bhagaḥ  saḥ  edhate  yam-yam  yujam  kṛṇute  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ ||

translations.text: Verily, for him all rivers flow; him do uninterrupted and numerous plural asures await; blessed with the felicity of the gods, he ever prospers, whomBrahmaṇaspatimakes his associate.

text.sanskrit: ऋजुरिच्छंसो वनवद्वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयंतमभ्यसत् ।सुप्रावीरिद्वनवत्पृत्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनं ॥
text.iast: ṛjuḥ  ít  śaṃsaḥ  vanavat  vanuṣyataḥ  deva-yan  ít  adeva-yantam  abhí  asat supra-avīḥ  ít  vanavat  pṛt-su  dustaram  yajvā  ít  ayajyoḥ  ví  bhajāti  bhojanam ||

translations.text: May the sincere praiser (ofBrahmaṇaspati) verily overcome (his) enemies; may the worshipper of the gods overcome him assuredly who does not reverence them; may the propitiatir (of Brahmaṇaspati) overcome him who is difficult to be overcome in battles; may he who offers sacrifice appropriate the food of him who does not sacrifice.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यजस्व वीर प्र विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कृणुष्व वृत्रतूर्ये ।हविष्कृणुष्व सुभगो यथाससि ब्रह्मणस्पतेरव आ वृणीमहे ॥
text.iast: yajasva  vīra  pra  vihi  manāyataḥ  bhadram  manaḥ  kṛṇuṣva  vṛtra-tūrye havíḥ  kṛṇuṣva  su-bhagaḥ  yathā  asasi  brahmaṇaḥ  pateḥ  avaḥ  ā  vṛṇīmahe ||

translations.text: Offer worship, O man, (toBrahmaṇaspati); proceed resolutely against those who are meditating (hostility); keep your mind firm in contending against foes; offer oblations whereby you may be prosperous; we also solicit the protection of Brahmaṇaspati.

text.sanskrit: यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घृतवद्भिरविधत्प्र तं प्राचा नयति ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ।उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषोऽंहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  asmai  havyaiḥ  ghṛtavat-bhiḥ  avidhat  pra  tam  prācā  nayati  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ uruṣyati  īm  aṃhasaḥ  rakṣati  riṣaḥ  aṃhoḥ  cit  asmai  uru-cakriḥ  adbhutaḥ ||

translations.text: Brahmaṇaspatileads by a straight path (to his reward), the worshipper who propitiates him with oblations of butter; he guards him against sin; he protects him from foes and from distress; and wonderful (in might) confers upon him many (favours).

text.sanskrit: इमा गिर आदित्येभ्यो घृतस्नूः सनाद्राजभ्यो जुह्वा जुहोमि ।शृणोतु मित्रो अर्यमा भगो नस्तुविजातो वरुणो दक्षो अंशः ॥
text.iast: imāḥ  gíraḥ  ādityebhyaḥ  ghṛta-snūḥ  sanāt  rāja-bhyaḥ  juhvā  juhomi śṛṇotu  mitraḥ  aryamā  bhagaḥ  naḥ  tuvi-jātaḥ  varuṇaḥ  dakṣaḥ  aṃśaḥ ||

translations.text: I present continually, with the ladle (of speech), these oblation-dropping hymns to the royalĀdityas; mayMitra,Aryaman,Bhaga, the multi-presentVaruṇa, the powerfulAṃśa, hear us.

text.sanskrit: इमं स्तोमं सक्रतवो मे अद्य मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो जुषंत ।आदित्यासः शुचयो धारपूता अवृजिना अनवद्या अरिष्टाः ॥
text.iast: imam  stomam  sa-kratavaḥ  me  adya  mitraḥ  aryamā  varuṇaḥ  juṣanta ādityāsaḥ  śucayaḥ  dhāra-pūtāḥ  avṛjināḥ  anavadyāḥ  ariṣṭāḥ ||

translations.text: May those of equal exploits,Mitra,Aryaman,Varuṇa, be plural ased today by this my praise; they who areĀdityas, luminous, purified by showers, who abandon none (that worship them), who are irreproachable unassailable.

text.iast: te  ādityāsaḥ  uravaḥ  gabhīrāḥ  adabdhāsaḥ  dípsantaḥ  bhūri-akṣāḥ antaríti  paśyanti  vṛjinā  uta  sādhu  sarvam  rāja-bhyaḥ  paramā  cit  anti ||

translations.text: ThoseĀdityas, mighty, profound, unsubdued, subduing, many-eyed, behold the innermost (thoughts of men), whether wicked or virtuous, whether far from or nigh to those royal (deities).

translations.text: The divineĀdityasare the upholders (of all things), moveable or immoveable; the protectors of the universe; the provident in acts; the collectors of rain; the possessors of veracity; the acquitters of our debts.

text.sanskrit: विद्यामादित्या अवसो वो अस्य यदर्यमन्भय आ चिन्मयोभु ।युष्माकं मित्रावरुणा प्रणीतौ परि श्वभ्रेव दुरितानि वृज्यां ॥
text.iast: vidyām  ādityāḥ  avasaḥ  vaḥ  asya  yat  aryaman  bhaye  ā  cit  mayaḥ-bhu yuṣmākam  mitrāvaruṇā  pra-nītau  pari  śvabhrā-iva  duḥ-itāni  vṛjyām ||

text.sanskrit: तिस्रो भूमीर्धारयन् त्रीँरुत द्यूंत्रीणि व्रता विदथे अंतरेषां ।ऋतेनादित्या महि वो महित्वं तदर्यमन्वरुण मित्र चारु ॥
text.iast: tisraḥ  bhūmīḥ  dhārayan  trīn  uta  dyūn  trīṇi  vratā  vidathe  antaḥ  eṣām ṛtena  ādityāḥ  mahi  vaḥ  mahi-tvam  tat  aryaman  varuṇa  mitra  cāru ||

translations.text: They uphold thethree worlds, the three heavens, and in their sacrifices three ceremonies (are comprised); by truth,Ādityas, has your great might (been produced), such as is most excellent;Aryaman,MitraandVaruṇa. (They uphold the three worlds: tisro bhumir dhārayan:bhūmi=loka, world, or sphere; earth, firmament, and heaven which the Ādityas support by supplying them with rain; the three heavens: trīḥ dyūn, the three luminous objects, dīptan; the threelokasabove the sky:mahar,jana,satya; or the three luminous deities:agni,vāyuandsūrya; three ceremonies: trīṇi vratā vidathe antar eṣām = lit. the three ceremonies in the sacrifice, in the midst of them; the three daily ceremonials are essentially one worship of the Ādityas; alternative meaning:in the midst of those worlds, there are three acts intended especially as the acts of the Ādityas, the absorption, retention, and redistribution of dew on rain].

text.sanskrit: या वो माया अभिद्रुहे यजत्राः पाशा आदित्या रिपवे विचृत्ताः ।अश्वीव ताँ अति येषं रथेनारिष्टा उरावा शर्मन्त्स्याम ॥
text.iast: yāḥ  vaḥ  māyāḥ  abhi-druhe  yajatrāḥ  pāśāḥ  ādityāḥ  ripave  ví-cṛttāḥ aśvī-iva  tān  ati  yeṣam  rathena  ariṣṭāḥ  urau  ā  śarman  syāma ||

translations.text: AdorableĀdityas, may I pass (safe) in your car from the illusions which (you devise) for the malignant, the snares which are spread for your foes, (in like manner) as a horseman (passes over a road); and thus may we abide secure in infinite felicity.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इदं कवेरादित्यस्य स्वराजो विश्वानि सांत्यभ्यस्तु मह्ना ।अति यो मंद्रो यजथाय देवः सुकीर्तिं भिक्षे वरुणस्य भूरेः ॥
text.iast: idam  kaveḥ  ādityasya  sva-rājaḥ  víśvāni  santi  abhí  astu  mahnā ati  yaḥ  mandraḥ  yajathāya  devaḥ  su-kīrtím  bhikṣe  varuṇasya  bhūreḥ ||

translations.text: (The worshipper repeats) this praise of the sage; the self-radiantĀditya; may he preside over all beings by his power; I beg for fame of the sovereignVaruṇa, a deity who, when much plural ased (is propitious) to hsi adorer.

text.sanskrit: तव व्रते सुभगासः स्याम स्वाध्यो वरुण तुष्टुवांसः ।उपायन उषसां गोमतीनामग्नयो न जरमाणा अनु द्यून् ॥
text.iast: tava  vrate  su-bhagāsaḥ  syāma  su-ādhyaḥ  varuṇa  tustu-vāṃsaḥ upa-ayane  uṣasām  go-matīnām  agnayaḥ  na  jaramāṇāḥ  anu  dyūn ||

translations.text: May we,Varuṇa, deeply meditating on you, earnestly praising you, and (engaged) in your worship, be prosperous; glorifying you daily, like the fires (that are kindled in your honour) at the coming of the luminous dawns.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तव स्याम पुरुवीरस्य शर्मन्नुरुशंसस्य वरुण प्रणेतः ।यूयं नः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धा अभि क्षमध्वं युज्याय देवाः ॥
text.iast: ava  syāma  puru-vīrasya  śarman  uru-śaṃsasya  varuṇa  pranetaríti pra-netaḥ yūyam  naḥ  putrāḥ  aditeḥ  adabdhāḥ  abhí  kṣamadhvam  yujyāya  devāḥ ||

translations.text: Varuṇa, chief guide (of men), may we abide in the felicity of you, who are endowed with great powers, and are glorified by many; divine sons ofAditi, unharmed (by foes), have compassion upon us through your benevolence.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: प्र सीमादित्यो असृजद्विधर्ताँ ऋतं सिंधवो वरुणस्य यंति ।न श्राम्यंति न वि मुचंत्येते वयो न पप्तू रघुया परिज्मन् ॥
text.iast: pra  sīm  ādityaḥ  asṛjat  vi-dhartā  ṛtam  síndhavaḥ  varuṇasya  yanti na  śrāmyanti  na  ví  mucanti  ete  vayaḥ  na  paptuḥ  raghu-yā  pari-jman ||

translations.text: TheĀditya, the upholder, has created all this water; the rivers flow by the power ofVaruṇa; they never weary, they never stop; they have descended with swiftness, like birds upon the circumambient (earth).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: वि मच्छ्रथाय रशनामिवाग ऋध्याम ते वरुण खामृतस्य ।मा तंतुश्छेदि वयतो धियं मे मा मात्रा शार्यपसः पुर ऋतोः ॥
text.iast: ví  mat  śrathaya  raśanām-iva  āgaḥ  ṛdhyāma  te  varuṇa  khām  ṛtasya mā  tantuḥ  chedi  vayataḥ  dhíyam  me  mā  mātrā  śāri  apasaḥ  purā  ṛtoḥ ||

translations.text: Cast off from me sin,Varuṇa, as if it were a rope; may we obtain from you a channel (filled) with water; cut not the thread of me (engaged in) weaving pious works; blight not the elements of holy rites before the season (of their maturity).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अपो सु म्यक्ष वरुण भियसं मत्सम्राळृतावोऽनु मा गृभाय ।दामेव वत्साद्वि मुमुग्ध्यंहो नहि त्वदारे निमिषश्चनेशे ॥
text.iast: apo íti  su  myakṣa  varuṇa  bhiyasam  mat  sam-rāṭ  ṛta-vaḥ  anu  mā  gṛbhāya dāma-iva  vatsāt  ví  mumugdhi  aṃhaḥ  nahí  tvat  āre  ni-míṣaḥ  cana  īśe ||

translations.text: Keep off all danger from me,Varuṇa; supreme monarch, endowed with truth, bestow your favour upon me; cast off (from me) sin, like a tether from a calf; no one rules for the twinkling of an eye, apart from you.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: मा नो वधैर्वरुण ये त इष्टावेनः कृण्वंतमसुर भ्रीणंति ।मा ज्योतिषः प्रवसथानि गन्म वि षू मृधः शिश्रथो जीवसे नः ॥
text.iast: mā  naḥ  vadhaiḥ  varuṇa  ye  te  iṣṭau  enaḥ  kṛṇvantam  asura  bhrīṇanti mā  jyotiṣaḥ  pra-vasathāni  ganma  ví  su  mṛdhaḥ  śiśrathaḥ  jīvase  naḥ ||

translations.text: Harm us not,Varuṇa, with those destructive (weapons), repeller (of foes), demolish him who does evil at your sacrifice; let us not depart (before our time) from the regions of light; scatter the malevolent, that we may live.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: नमः पुरा ते वरुणोत नूनमुतापरं तुविजात ब्रवाम ।त्वे हि कं पर्वते न श्रितान्यप्रच्युतानि दूळभ व्रतानि ॥
text.iast: namaḥ  purā  te  varuṇa  uta  nūnam  uta  aparam  tuvi-jāta  bravāma tve íti  hí  kam  parvate  na  śritāni  apra-cyutāni  duḥ-dabha  vratāni ||

translations.text: As we have offered adoration to you,Varuṇa, of old, in like manner as we offer it now, so may we offer it in future (to you), who are everywhere present; for in you, who are difficult of attainment, as in an (immoveable) mountain, all holy acts are assembled, and are not to be dissevered.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: पर ऋणा सावीरध मत्कृतानि माहं राजन्नन्यकृतेन भोजं ।अव्युष्टा इन्नु भूयसीरुषास आ नो जीवान्वरुण तासु शाधि ॥
text.iast: parā  ṛṇā  sāvīḥ  adha  mat-kṛtāni  mā  aham  rājan  anya-kṛtena  bhojam avi-uṣṭāḥ  ít  nu  bhūyasīḥ  uṣasaḥ  ā  naḥ  jīvān  varuṇa  tāsu  śādhi ||

translations.text: Discharge,Varuṇa, the debts (contracted), by my progenitors, and those now (contracted) by me; and may I not, royal Varuṇa, be dependent (on the debts contracted) by another; many are the mornings that have, as it were, indeed not dawned; make us, Varuṇa, alive in them.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.
