text.sanskrit: यो मे राजन्युज्यो वा सखा वा स्वप्ने भयं भीरवे मह्यमाह ।स्तेनो वा यो दिप्सति नो वृको वा त्वं तस्माद्वरुण पाह्यस्मान् ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  me  rājan  yujyaḥ  vā  sakhā  vā  svapne  bhayam  bhīrave  mahyam  āha stenaḥ  vā  yaḥ  dípsati  naḥ  vṛkaḥ  vā  tvam  tasmāt  varuṇa  pāhi  asmān ||

translations.text: Protect us,Varuṇa, against every peril which a kinsman or a friend threatens me with alarmed in sleep; or from a thief or a wolf that attempts to destroy us.

text.sanskrit: धृतव्रता आदित्या इषिरा आरे मत्कर्त रहसूरिवागः ।शृण्वतो वो वरुण मित्र देवा भद्रस्य विद्वाँ अवसे हुवे वः ॥
text.iast: dhṛta-vratāḥ  ādityāḥ  íṣirāḥ  āre  mat  karta  rahasūḥ-iva  āgaḥ śṛṇvataḥ  vaḥ  varuṇa  mítra  devāḥ  bhadrasya  vidvān  avase  huve  vaḥ ||

translations.text: Ādityas, upholders of pious works, and who are to be sought by all, remove sin far from me, like a woman delivered in secret; knowing,Mitra,Varuṇaand (universal) gods, the good that follows from your hearing our prayers, I invoke you for (our) protection.

text.sanskrit: यूयं देवाः प्रमतिर्यूयमोजो यूयं द्वेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत ।अभिक्षत्तारो अभि च क्षमध्वमद्या च नो मृळयतापरं च ॥
text.iast: yūyam  devāḥ  pra-matiḥ  yūyam  ojaḥ  yūyam  dveṣāṃsi  sanutaḥ  yuyota abhi-kṣattāraḥ  abhí  ca  kṣamadhvam  adya  ca  naḥ  mṛḷayata  aparam  ca ||

translations.text: You, gods, are intelligence, you are vigour; do you drive away the malevolent subduers (of enemies), overcome them entirely, and grant us felicity both now and in future.

text.sanskrit: किमू नु वः कृणवामापरेण किं सनेन वसव आप्येन ।यूयं नो मित्रावरुणादिते च स्वस्तिमिंद्रामरुतो दधात ॥
text.iast: kím  ūṃ íti  nu  vaḥ  kṛṇavāma  apareṇa  kím  sanena  vasavaḥ  āpyena yūyam  naḥ  mitrāvaruṇā  adite  ca  svastím  indrāmarutaḥ  dadhāta ||

translations.text: What may we do for you, gods, either now, or in the future; what may we do,Vasus, by perpetual and practicable (acts of devotion); do you,Mitra,Varuṇa,Aditi,Indraand theMaruts, maintain our bell-being.

text.sanskrit: हये देवा यूयमिदापयः स्थ ते मृळत नाधमानाय मह्यं ।मा वो रथो मध्यमवाळृते भून्मा युष्मावत्स्वापिषु श्रमिष्म ॥
text.iast: haye  devāḥ  yūyam  ít  āpayaḥ  stha  te  mṛḷata  nādhamānāya  mahyam mā  vaḥ  rathaḥ  madhyama-vāṭ  ṛte  bhūt  mā  yuṣmāvat-su  āpíṣu  śramiṣma ||

translations.text: O Gods, you, verily, are our kinsmen; being so, grant felicity to me your suppliant; let not your chariot be tardy in coming to the sacrifice; let us never be weary of relatives such as you are.

text.sanskrit: प्र व एको मिमय भूर्यागो यन्मा पितेव कितवं शशास ।आरे पाशा आरे अघानि देवा मा माधि पुत्रे विमिव ग्रभीष्ट ॥
text.iast: pra  vaḥ  ekaḥ  mimaya  bhūri  āgaḥ  yat  mā  pitā-iva  kitavam  śaśāsa āre  pāśāḥ  āre  aghāni  devāḥ  mā  mā  adhi  putre  vím-iva  grabhīṣṭa ||

translations.text: Alone among you, I have committed many offences, (which correct) as a father corrects a naughty (son); far from me, gods, bebonds; far from be sins; size not upon me (your) son as (a fowler) catches a bird.

text.sanskrit: अर्वांचो अद्या भवता यजत्रा आ वो हार्दि भयमानो व्ययेयं ।त्राध्वं नो देवा निजुरो वृकस्य त्राध्वं कर्तादवपदो यजत्राः ॥

translations.text: Adorable (deities), be present today, that, apprehensive of danger, I may feel sure of your healthy (support); protect us, gods, from the rapacity of the wolf; protect us, adorable (deities), from him who would work us misfortune.

text.sanskrit: ऋतं देवाय कृण्वते सवित्र इंद्रायाहिघ्ने न रमंत आपः ।अहरहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या प्रथमः सर्ग आसां ॥
text.iast: ṛtam  devāya  kṛṇvate  savitre  índrāya  ahi-ghne  na  ramante  āpaḥ ahaḥ-ahaḥ  yāti  aktuḥ  apām  kíyati  ā  prathamaḥ  sargaḥ  āsām ||

translations.text: The waters cease not (to flow in libations) to the divineIndra, the sender of rain, the animator (of all), the slayer of Ahi; day by day proceeds the current of the waters; at what period of time was their first creation.

text.sanskrit: यो वृत्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत्प्र तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच ।पथो रदंतीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवेदिवे धुनयो यंत्यर्थं ॥

translations.text: His mother, (Aditi), declared to him the man who had offered (sacrificial) food toVṛtra;obedient to his plural asure, the rivers, tracing out their paths, flow day by day to their object, (the ocean).

translations.text: Inasmuch as he had soared aloft above the firmamentIndrahurled againstVṛtrahis destructive (thunderbolt); enveloped in a cloud, he rushed upon Indra, but the wielder of the sharp-edged weapon triumphed over his foe.

text.sanskrit: बृहस्पते तपुषाश्नेव विध्य वृकद्वरसो असुरस्य वीरान् ।यथा जघंथ धृषता पुरा चिदेवा जहि शत्रुमस्माकमिंद्र ॥

translations.text: Pierce,Bṛhaspati, with a radiant shaft,  as with a thunderbolt, the sons of theasuraguarding his gates; in like manner as you did formerly slayVṛtraby your own prowess, so do you now destroy our enemy.

translations.text: Achieve, hero, along with our valiant heroes, the exploits that are to be achieved by you; long have (our enemies) been inflated (with pride); slay them, and bring to us their treasures.

translations.text: I invoke, with suitable praise,Rākā, who is worthily invoked; may she, who is auspicious of good fortune, hear us, and spontaneously understand (our purpose); may she sew her work with an infallible needle; may she grant us excellent and opulent descendants.

text.sanskrit: उक्षंते अश्वाँ अत्याँ इवाजिषु नदस्य कर्णैस्तुरयंत आशुभिः ।हिरण्यशिप्रा मरुतो दविध्वतः पृक्षं याथ पृषतीभिः समन्यवः ॥
text.iast: ukṣante  aśvān  atyān-iva  ājíṣu  nadasya  karṇaiḥ  turayante  āśu-bhiḥ híraṇya-śiprāḥ  marutaḥ  davidhvataḥ  pṛkṣam  yātha  pṛṣatībhiḥ  sa-manyavaḥ ||

translations.text: They sprinkle the wide-extended (lands) with water, as (men sprinkle) horses (when heated) in battles; and they rush along with swift (horses) on the skirts of the sounding (cloud);Maruts, golden-helmeted, andof one mind, agitating (the trees), come with your spotted deer to (receive the sacrificial) food.

text.sanskrit: पृक्षे ता विश्वा भुवना ववक्षिरे मित्राय वा सदमा जीरदानवः ।पृषदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधस ऋजिप्यासो न वयुनेषु धूर्षदः ॥

text.sanskrit: इंधन्वभिर्धेनुभी रप्शदूधभिरध्वस्मभिः पथिभिर्भ्राजदृष्टयः ।आ हंसासो न स्वसराणि गंतन मधोर्मदाय मरुतः समन्यवः ॥
text.iast: índhanva-bhiḥ  dhenu-bhiḥ  rapśadūdha-bhiḥ  adhvasma-bhiḥ  pathí-bhiḥ  bhrājat-ṛṣṭayaḥ ā  haṃsāsaḥ  na  svasarāṇi  gantana  madhoḥ  madāya  marutaḥ  sa-manyavaḥ ||

translations.text: Maruts, who are of one mind, and are armed with shining lances, come with the bright, full-uddered kine, by obstructed paths, to partake of the exhilaration of the (Soma) juice, as swans (fly) to their nests.

text.sanskrit: आ नो ब्रह्माणि मरुतः समन्यवो नरां न शंसः सवनानि गंतन ।अश्वामिव पिप्यत धेनुमूधनि कर्ता धियं जरित्रे वाजपेशसं ॥
text.iast: ā  naḥ  brahmāṇi  marutaḥ  sa-manyavaḥ  narām  na  śaṃsaḥ  savanāni  gantana aśvām-iva  pipyata  dhenum  ūdhani  kartā  dhíyam  jaritre  vāja-peśasam ||

translations.text: Maruts, who are of one mind, come to the food that is offered at (our) sacrifices, as (you come) to the praises of men; nourish the cow, (the cloud), so that it may be like a mare with a full udder, and render the pious rite productive of abundant food to the worshipper.

text.sanskrit: तं नो दात मरुतो वाजिनं रथ आपानं ब्रह्म चितयद्दिवेदिवे ।इषं स्तोतृभ्यो वृजनेषु कारवे सनिं मेधामरिष्टं दुष्टरं सहः ॥

translations.text: Bestow upon us,Maruts, that (son) who shall enjoy abundance, and who shall be repeating your appropriate praises day by day to (induce) your coming; give food to those who praise you; to him who glorifies you in battles; (grant him) liberality, intelligence, and unimpaired unsurpassable vigour.

text.sanskrit: यद्युंजते मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसोऽश्वान्रथेषु भग आ सुदानवः ।धेनुर्न शिश्वे स्वसरेषु पिन्वते जनाय रातहविषे महीमिषं ॥

translations.text: When the golden-breasted munificentMaruts, yoke their horses to their chariots on an auspicious (occasion), they shed in their peculiar (directions) abundant food upon him who offers them oblations, as a cow (gives milk) to her calf.

text.sanskrit: यो नो मरुतो वृकताति मर्त्यो रिपुर्दधे वसवो रक्षता रिषः ।वर्तयत तपुषा चक्रियाभि तमव रुद्रा अशसो हंतना वधः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  naḥ  marutaḥ  vṛka-tāti  martyaḥ  ripuḥ  dadhe  vasavaḥ  rakṣata  riṣaḥ vartayata  tapuṣā  cakríyā  abhí  tam  ava  rudrāḥ  aśasaḥ  hantana  vadharíti ||

translations.text: Maruts, granters of dwellings, protect us from the malignity of the man who cherishes wolf-like enmity against us; encompass him with your burning diseases; ward off the murderous (weapon) of the devourer.

text.sanskrit: चित्रं तद्वो मरुतो याम चेकिते पृश्न्या यदूधरप्यापयो दुहुः ।यद्वा निदे नवमानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रितं जराय जुरतामदाभ्याः ॥
text.iast: citram  tat  vaḥ  marutaḥ  yāma  cekite  pṛśnyāḥ  yat  ūdhaḥ  api  āpayaḥ  duhuḥ yat  vā  nide  navamānasya  rudriyāḥ  tritam  jarāya  juratām  adābhyāḥ ||

translations.text: Maruts, your marvellous energy is well known, whereby, seizing the udder of heaven, you milked it (of the rain, destroyed) the reviler of your worshipper, and (came), irresistible sons ofRudra, toTritafor the destruction of enemies.

text.sanskrit: तान्वो महो मरुत एवयाव्नो विष्णोरेषस्य प्रभृथे हवामहे ।हिरण्यवर्णान्ककुहान्यतस्रुचो ब्रह्मण्यंतः शंस्यं राध ईमहे ॥
text.iast: tān  vaḥ  mahaḥ  marutaḥ  eva-yāvnaḥ  víṣṇoḥ  eṣasya  pra-bhṛthe  havāmahe híraṇya-varṇān  kakuhān  yata-srucaḥ  brahmaṇyantaḥ  śaṃsyam  rādhaḥ  īmahe ||

translations.text: We invoke you, mightyMaruts, who frequent such sacrifices (as this, to be present) at the offering of the diffusive and desirable (libation); lifting up our ladles, and reciting their praise, we solicit the golden-hued and lofty Maruts for excellent wealth.

text.sanskrit: ते दशग्वाः प्रथमा यज्ञमूहिरे ते नो हिन्वंतूषसो व्युष्टिषु ।उषा न रामीररुणैरपोर्णुते महो ज्योतिषा शुचता गोअर्णसा ॥

translations.text: May they, who, the first celebrators of the ten-months' rite, accomplished this sacrifice, reanimate us at the rising dawn; for as the dawn with purple rays drives away the night, so (do they scatter the darkness) with great, and pure, and mist-dispelling radiance.

text.sanskrit: ते क्षोणीभिररुणेभिर्नांजिभी रुद्रा ऋतस्य सदनेषु वावृधुः ।निमेघमाना अत्येन पाजसा सुश्चंद्रं वर्णं दधिरे सुपेशसं ॥

translations.text: They, theRudras, (equipped) with melodious (lutes), and decorated with purple ornaments, exult in the dwellings of the waters; and scattering the clouds with rappid vigour, they are endowed with delightful and beautiful forms.

text.sanskrit: ताँ इयानो महि वरूथमूतय उप घेदेना नमसा गृणीमसि ।त्रितो न यान्पंच होतॄनभिष्टय आववर्तदवरांचक्रियावसे ॥

text.sanskrit: यया रध्रं पारयथात्यंहो यया निदो मुंचथ वंदितारं ।अर्वाची सा मरुतो या व ऊतिरो षु वाश्रेव सुमतिर्जिगातु ॥

translations.text: Maruts, may that protection wherewith you convey the worshipper beyond sin, wherewith you rescue the reciter of your praise from the scoffer, be present with us; may your benign disposition tend towards us, like a lowing (cow towards her calf).

text.sanskrit: उपेमसृक्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे ।अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित्स सुपेशसस्करति जोषिषद्धि ॥

translations.text: Desiring food, I put forth this laudatory hymn; may the sounding and swift-moving grandson of the waters bestow abundant food upon me his worshipper; may he make us of goodly appearance, for verily he is propitiated by praise.

text.sanskrit: इमं स्वस्मै हृद आ सुतष्टं मंत्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत् ।अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान ॥

text.sanskrit: समन्या यंत्युप यंत्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पृणंति ।तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः ॥

text.sanskrit: स्व आ दमे सुदुघा यस्य धेनुः स्वधां पीपाय सुभ्वन्नमत्ति ।सो अपां नपादूर्जयन्नप्स्वंतर्वसुदेयाय विधते वि भाति ॥

text.sanskrit: अपां नपादा ह्यस्थादुपस्थं जिह्मानामूर्ध्वो विद्युतं वसानः ।तस्य ज्येष्ठं महिमानं वहंतीर्हिरण्यवर्णाः परि यंति यह्वीः ॥
text.iast: apām  napāt  ā  hí  asthāt  upa-stham  jihmānām  ūrdhvaḥ  vi-dyutam  vasānaḥ tasya  jyeṣṭham  mahimānam  vahantīḥ  híraṇya-varṇāḥ  pari  yanti  yahvīḥ ||

translations.text: The grandson of the waters has ascended the firmament above (the region) of the tortuously-moving (clouds), arrayed in lightning; the broad and golden-coloured (rivers) spread around, bearing (to all quarters) his exceeding glory.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: हिरण्यरूपः स हिरण्यसंदृगपां नपात्सेदु हिरण्यवर्णः ।हिरण्ययात्परि योनेर्निषद्या हिरण्यदा ददत्यन्नमस्मै ॥
text.iast: híraṇya-rūpaḥ  saḥ  híraṇya-sandṛk  apām  napāt  saḥ  ít  ūṃ íti  híraṇya-varṇaḥ hiraṇyayāt  pari  yoneḥ  ni-sadya  hiraṇya-dāḥ  dadati  annam  asmai ||

translations.text: The grandson of the waters is of olden form, of golden aspect, of golden hue, and (shines) seated upon a seat of gold; the givers of gold (at solemn rites) present to him (sacrificial) food.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तदस्यानीकमुत चारु नामापीच्यं वर्धते नप्तुरपां ।यमिंधते युवतयः समित्था हिरण्यवर्णं घृतमन्नमस्य ॥
text.iast: tat  asya  anīkam  uta  cāru  nāma  apīcyam  vardhate  naptuḥ  apām yam  indhate  yuvatayaḥ  sam  itthā  híraṇya-varṇam  ghṛtam  annam  asya ||

translations.text: Beautiful is his form (of aggregated lustre, beautiful) is the name of the grandson of the waters; (both) flourish, though  hidden (by the clouds); the youthful w2aters collectively kindle the golden-coloured divinity in the firmament, for water is his food.

text.sanskrit: अस्मै बहूनामवमाय सख्ये यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः ।सं सानु मार्ज्मि दिधिषामि बिल्मैर्दधाम्यन्नैः परि वंद ऋग्भिः ॥
text.iast: asmai  bahūnām  avamāya  sakhye  yajñaiḥ  vidhema  namasā  havíḥ-bhiḥ sam  sānu  mārjmi  dídhiṣāmi  bílmaiḥ  dadhāmi  annaiḥ  pari  vande  ṛk-bhíḥ ||

translations.text: To him our friend, the first of many (deities), we offer worship with sacrifices, oblations, and prostration; I decorate the high plural ce (of his presence); I nourish him with fuel; I sustain him with (sacrificial) viands; I glorify him with hymns.

text.sanskrit: स ईं वृषाजनयत्तासु गर्भं स ईं शिशुर्धयति तं रिहंति ।सो अपां नपादनभिम्लातवर्णोऽन्यस्येवेह तन्वा विवेष ॥
text.iast: saḥ  īm  vṛṣā  ajanayat  tāsu  garbham  saḥ  īm  śíśuḥ  dhayati  tam  rihanti saḥ  apām  napāt  anabhimlāta-varṇaḥ  anyasya-iva  iha  tanvā  viveṣa ||

translations.text: Vigorous, he has genitive rated himself as an embryo in those (waters); he is their infant; he sucks them; they bedew him (with moisture); the grandson of the waters of untarnished splendour has descended to this (earth) in the form of a different (fire).

text.sanskrit: अस्मिन्पदे परमे तस्थिवांसमध्वस्मभिर्विश्वहा दीदिवांसं ।आपो नप्त्रे घृतमन्नं वहंतीः स्वयमत्कैः परि दीयंति यह्वीः ॥

translations.text: The abundant waters, bearing sustenance to their grandson, flow round him with spontaneous movements; when abiding in his supreme sphere, and shining daily with imperishable (rays).

text.sanskrit: अयांसमग्ने सुक्षितिं जनायायांसमु मघवद्भ्यः सुवृक्तिं ।विश्वं तद्भद्रं यदवंति देवा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: ayāṃsam  agne  su-kṣitím  janāya  ayāṃsam  ūṃ íti  maghavat-bhyaḥ  su-vṛktím víśvam  tat  bhadram  yat  avanti  devāḥ  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: I have come,Agni, to you, (the giver) of good dwellings, for the sake of offspring; I have come with a propitiatory hymn for the sake of the opulent (offerers of oblations); may all the good which the gods defend (be ours); that, blessed with excellent descendants, we may worthily glorify you at this sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपोऽधुक्षन्त्सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः ।पिबेंद्र स्वाहा प्रहुतं वषट्कृतं होत्रादा सोमं प्रथमो य ईशिषे ॥
text.iast: tubhyam  hinvānaḥ  vasiṣṭa  gāḥ  apaḥ  adhukṣan  sīm  avi-bhiḥ  adri-bhiḥ  naraḥ píba  indra  svāhā  pra-hutam  vaṣaṭ-kṛtam  hotrāt  ā  somam  prathamaḥ  yaḥ  īśiṣe ||

translations.text: (The libation) that is being presented,Indra, to you, comprises the (products of the) cow, and he (consecrated) water; and the leaders (of the rite) have expressed it with stones, and strained it through woollen (filters); do you, Indra, who are the first (of the gods), and rule (over the world), drink theSomaoffered by theHotā, and sanctified by the exclamationssvāhāand vaṣat.

text.sanskrit: यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पृषतीभिर्ऋष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अंजिषु प्रिया उत ।आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः ॥

translations.text: Maruts, together worshipped with sacrifices, standing in the car drawn by spotted mares, radiant with lances, and delighted by ornaments, sons ofBharata, leaders in the firmament, seated on the sacred grass, drink theSomapresented by thePotā.

text.iast: amā-iva  naḥ  su-havāḥ  ā  hí  gantana  ní  barhíṣi  sadatana  raṇiṣṭana atha  mandasva  jujuṣāṇaḥ  andhasaḥ  tvaṣṭaḥ  devebhiḥ  jani-bhiḥ  sumat-gaṇaḥ ||

translations.text: Do you, who are devoutly invoked, come to us together, and, seated on the sacrificial grass, enjoy your rest; and then,Tvaṣṭā, who head a brilliant cohort (come) with the gods and their wives, and rejoice being plural ased with the (sacrificial) food.

text.sanskrit: आ वक्षि देवाँ इह विप्र यक्षि चोशन्होतर्नि षदा योनिषु त्रिषु ।प्रति वीहि प्रस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पिबाग्नीध्रात्तव भागस्य तृप्णुहि ॥

translations.text: SageAgni, bring hither the gods, and sacrifice to them; invoker of the gods, propitious to us, sit down in the three altars; accept the libation ofSomathat is offered to you, from theAgnidhraand be satisfied with your portion.

translations.text: MitraandVaruṇa, both be gratified with the sacrifice; hear my invocation as the seatedHotārepeats in succession the ancient praises; the (sacrificial) food encompassed (by the priests), attends the royal pair drink, both of you, the sweetSomalibation, offered by the Praśāstā.

text.sanskrit: जोष्यग्ने समिधं जोष्याहुतिं जोषि ब्रह्म जन्यं जोषि सुष्टुतिं ।विश्वेभिर्विश्वाँ ऋतुना वसो मह उशंदेवाँ उशतः पायया हविः ॥

text.sanskrit: उदु ष्य देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात् ।नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद्वीतिहोत्रं स्वस्तौ ॥
text.iast: ut  ūṃ íti  syaḥ  devaḥ  savitā  savāya  śaśvat-tamam  tat-apāḥ  vahniḥ  asthāt nūnam  devebhyaḥ  ví  hí  dhāti  ratnam  atha  ā  abhajat  vītí-hotram  svastau ||

translations.text: In truth, the divineSavitā, the bearer (of the world), has perpetually been present for the genitive ration (of mankind), for such is his office; verily he grants wealth to the pious (worshippers); may he, therefore, bestow upon the offerer of the oblation (sufficient) for his well-being.

translations.text: She, (Night), enwraps the extended (world) like (a woman) weaving (a garment); the prudent man lays aside the work he is able (to execute) in the midst (of his labour); but all spring up (from repose) when the divine, unwearied Sun, who has divided the seasons, again appears.

text.sanskrit: प्रदक्षिणिदभि गृणंति कारवो वयो वदंत ऋतुथा शकुंतयः ।उभे वाचौ वदति सामगा इव गायत्रं च त्रैष्टुभं चानु राजति ॥
text.iast: pra-dakṣiṇít  abhí  gṛṇanti  kāravaḥ  vayaḥ  vadantaḥ  ṛtu-thā  śakuntayaḥ ubhe íti  vācau  vadati  sāmagāḥ-iva  gāyatram  ca  traistubham  ca  anu  rājati ||

translations.text: Let the birds in quest of their food, according to the season, proclaim their circumambulations like the celebrators (of sacred rites); he utters both notes, as the chanter of thesāmarecites the gayatrī and tṛṣṭubh, and delights (the hearers).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: उद्गातेव शकुने साम गायसि ब्रह्मपुत्र इव सवनेषु शंससि ।वृषेव वाजी शिशुमतीरपीत्या सर्वतो नः शकुने भद्रमा वद विश्वतो नः शकुने पुण्यमा वद ॥
text.iast: udgātā-iva  śakune  sāma  gāyasi  brahmaputraḥ-iva  savaneṣu  śaṃsasi vṛṣā-iva  vājī  śíśu-matīḥ  api-ítya  sarvataḥ  naḥ  śakune  bhadram  ā  vada  viśvataḥ  naḥ  śakune  puṇyam  ā  vada ||

translations.text: You sing, Bird, like theudgatāchanting thesāma; you murmur like the brahmaputra at sacrifices; like a horse (neighing) when approaching a mare do you proclaim (aloud) to us good fortune from every quarter; proclaim aloud prosperity to us from every direction.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आवदंस्त्वं शकुने भद्रमा वद तूष्णीमासीनः सुमतिं चिकिद्धि नः ।यदुत्पतन्वदसि कर्करिर्यथा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: ā-vadan  tvam  śakune  bhadram  ā  vada  tūṣṇīm  āsīnaḥ  su-matím  cikiddhi  naḥ yat  ut-patan  vadasi  karkaríḥ  yathā  bṛhat  vadema  vidathe  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: When uttering your cry, O Bird, proclaim good fortune; when sitting silently cherish kind thoughts towards us; when you cry as you are flying, let the sound be like that of a lute; so that, blessed with excellent descendants, we may worthily praise you at this sacrifice.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.
